description: From March 6 2020,Russia, Novgorod region, organizes informing the population about measures for the prevention of coronavirus infection, and territories, unfavorable for the sanitary and epidemiological situation associated with covid-19 through the media.

The Ministry of Health of Chuvashia denied the information that appeared on the Internet about the allegedly first case of coronavirus infection in the republic. The data on the sick person is fake, the ministry's press service reported.

Russia, as of March 19, law enforcement agencies of Lipetsk region check publications on social networks and identify those who disseminate false information, claiming that "authors of fake news will be prosecuted in compliance with the Administrative Code of the Russian Federation".

On March 20, Russian media have warned of responsibility for spreading false data about the spread of coronavirus. This is reported by Roskomnadzor.The Agency conducts round-the-clock monitoring of media, social networks, shopping malls and video hosting sites to detect fakes. Strict measures will be applied to violators, including complete and immediate restriction of access to the resource and revocation of the license.

On March 20, The Ministry of internal Affairs of Kalmykia also provided for administrative responsibility for the dissemination of false information related to a coronavirus infection under the guise of reliable reports that pose a threat to public order and security.
Russia, Magadan Government  has developed a policy that involves taking legal action against those spreading false information about COVID starting from March 20

On March 23, the Government of the Tula Region (Russia) published a warning post on its official website, informing the people about COVID-19 threat to the public health and urging people to trust official sources only (the Government and licensed media), while avoiding misinformation (Anti-Disinformation Measures).
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On March 23, the main non-staff expert of Moscow oblast Ministry of Health has digested all disinformation, informs the press office of regional authority

The Government of the Tula Region (Russia) warned on its official website on March 24 that Roskomnadzor conducts round-the-clock monitoring of all media outlets, social networks and video hosting sites in order to identify inaccurate information provoking public concern. Strict measures are taken against the media and Internet resources that distribute inaccurate or misleading information, up to a complete restriction of access to those media and revocation of licenses (Anti-Disinformation Measures).
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force,Other (Please specify in the text box)

enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description: On March 31, the State Duma adopted policies to resolve the situation with coronavirus in Russia. So, for violation of quarantine people face punishment up to imprisonment for up to seven years, and for spreading fake news about coronavirus - up to three years in prison. This also will work in Primorskiy region where a married couple from Israel and a young man arrived from England did not follow quarantine.

The Russian legislature passes amendments to the administrative and criminal codes on March 31 classifying violations related to epidemiological safety, states of alert or emergency, and the spread of misinformation related to such situations as administrative and/or criminal offenses with increasing punishments if said violations lead to deaths.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description:
On April 23, in Kurgan region, a young man in one of the popular social networks claimed that “there is no coronavirus,” and also called not to believe the official information about the spread of coronavirus.
The court found the man guilty and sentenced a fine of 30 thousand rubles.

description: Starting from March 17, In Ufa, Bashkortostan (Russia), the cabinet system in schools was canceled. In other words, students no longer move from room to room for different classes but stay in their classrooms for the day. Furthermore, in accordance with the recommendation of Rospotrebnadzor, educational institutions in Ufa are instructed to disinfect premises. It was also instructed to exclude the organization and attendance of public events by children and employees. Collective trips of children and employees outside the country and to other cities of the Russian Federation are not recommended. All educational institutions must conduct daily monitoring of the reasons for the absence of children in class.
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools allowed to open with conditions

description: Due to the threat of the spread of coronavirus, all schoolchildren of Voronezh were sent to early vacations, the city hall press service said. They will last from March 17 to March 24. Recommendations to transfer all schoolchildren of the country to online education were issued by the head of the Ministry of Education Sergey Kravtsov. Russia informs"On March 30, in the Orenburg region, duty groups began to work in kindergartens for children whose parents work during the weekend announced by the President of the Russian Federation.

description: The Government of the Primorsky Territory announced that on April 15, it was decided to partially restrict entry and exit from the territory of the village of Podyapolskoye. The measure will be valid until April 29.

Saturday, April 18, control at the entrances to the Kurgan region is strengthened. On the highways, as well as at the entrances to a number of settlements (including Dalmatovo, Chimeevo), checkpoints will be set up and additional traffic police patrols will be posted.
This is due to the need to prevent a mass gathering of people in the Orthodox churches of the region during the celebration of Easter.


Please note that only residents of the region will be admitted to the territory of the Kurgan Region, as well as citizens who have arrived from other constituent entities of the Russian Federation for treatment, participation in a funeral or performing official duties (if there are supporting documents).
Residents of neighboring regions wishing to attend services in Kurgan temples will not be able to enter the region due to the current self-isolation regime.


We remind you that for violations that entailed the threat of the spread of the disease, administrative liability is provided in accordance with federal and regional legislation.


For failure to comply with regional requirements for self-isolation, fines are provided for citizens in the amount of 1 to 3 thousand rubles, for officials - from 10 to 30 thousand rubles, for legal entities and individual entrepreneurs - from 30 to 50 thousand rubles.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: In Russia, by presidential decree, it is decided on April 18 that foreign citizens migration status is extended from March 15 to June 15 including period of legal stay, registration, migration cards, certificates of refugee or compatriot migration status, work documents, and deportation orders. Foreign citizens without work documents are allowed to work. No new migration violations will be conferred (no new deportation or expulsion orders)
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Russia: Starting from 21 April 2020, Buryatia ordered to organize joint posts on the territory of the Republic of Buryatia to measure the body temperature of citizens entering the territory of the Republic of Buryatia, study the purpose of their entry into the territory of the Republic of Buryatia and the route.

Russia: Starting from 21 April 2020, Buryatia ordered to organize joint posts on the territory of the Republic of Buryatia to measure the body temperature of citizens entering the territory of the Republic of Buryatia, study the purpose of their entry into the territory of the Republic of Buryatia and the route.

In Russia, a change to the migration legislation is introduced on April 24 as a permanent amendment, allowing workers from visa-free countries of the former Soviet Commonwealth of Independence States to renew their work documents (patents) repeatedly each year (no limit on the number of renewals) without leaving the country.

description: Starting from 15 of July, the government of Crimea asks all people entering the peninsula to show negative coronavirus test results or send them to Rospetrobnadzor in three days upon entering the republic.

The Russian Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin signed a decree on July 24 to resume issuing visas and allow entry into Russia for citizens of the UK, Turkey, and Tanzenia. All other restrictions on foreign citizens remain in place, with exceptions for certain categories of people (diplomats, employees of international organizations, transport crews, family members of Russian citizens, permanent residents who are in transit, and certain categories of citizens who have visa-free privileges, participants of the migrant repatriation program, athletes and coaches, transit passengers, Belarussian citizens working for resource companies, employees of the Baikonur space center in Kazakhstan, those seeking medical treatment, those who need to care for close family members who are ill, and highly qualified specialists on a list approved by the Federal Security Service and Ministry of Internal Affairs). The policy ends August 1 when it is superseded by a new policy that allows citizens of Switzerland and Abkhazia to enter Russia.

description: Russia "recommends to persons arriving on the territory. Orenburg region, including from the territories of other subjects of the Russian Federation, within 3 calendar days from the date of arrival, undergo a test for a new coronavirus infection by the PCR method and be isolated at the place of residence, exclude contacts with family members and other persons who were not on isolation until a negative the result of laboratory research on COVID-19. In the absence of the possibility of passing the examination, be in isolation at the place of residence for 14 days from the date of arrival on the territory of the Orenburg region, excluding contacts with family members and other persons and those who were in isolation."The external border restrictions policy takes effect starting from September 28.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Foreign Affairs,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
Russia "obliges foreign citizens entering the territory of the Orenburg region from the border territory of Kazakhstan when crossing the state border of the Russian Federation, entering the Orenburg region:

The external border restrictions policy takes effect starting from September 28.

description: In Russia, at domestic flights and railway stations of Samara and Syzran, they will introduce anti-epidemic control starting from January 1st.
Russia recommends that regional governments monitor Chinese students returning from New Years holidays from January 24.

description:
As was reported on January 24, sanitary control on flights from China has been strengthened at the “Ufa” airport in Ufa, Bashkortostan (Russia). Passengers arriving on flights from China are examined by Rospotrebnadzor specialists on board of the aircraft using thermal imagers (non-contact thermometers). 
Sanitary doctors urge tourists traveling to China to take precautions: to not visit markets and zoos, eat only thermally processed food, bottled water, use masks, wash hands more often, and refrain from traveling to the city of Wuhan, where an outbreak of the disease is observed, until stabilization of the situation.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: The Moscow (Russia) city government creates mobile medical brigades to check on (take temperatures of) tourists from China in their hotels from January 28.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Moscow, Chinese students returning from vacation will undergo daily health monitoring from January 30.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In Russia, those in contact (not close, e.g. work) with diagnosed patients are monitored in their homes for 14 days beginning January 31.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
Russian Federation, Altaiskiy Krai, on January 31, the Governor of the Altai Krai signed a Plan of organizational sanitary and anti-epidemic measures to prevent the import and spread of a new coronavirus infection.

When patients with symptoms of COVID-19 come, doctors are instructed to survey whether they have been in the area of infection in the past 14 - 20 days. In the case of a positive response, patients are isolated and tested for coronavirus. Even if the diagnosis is not confirmed, the patient undergoes the necessary treatment.

On January 31, the chief sanitary doctor of Kabardino-Balkaria Republic (Russia) has made a resolution "On the organization of monitoring of persons arriving from China", stating that travellers arriving from China are to be monitored for 14 days and to be isolated in case of displaying COVID-19 symptoms.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: According to the order of the Governor of Kursk region from 10.03.20, employers in the Kursk region are obliged to ensure the measurement of body temperature to workers at workplaces, with the obligatory suspension of persons with an elevated temperature from being at the workplace.

Starting from March 10, the government of the Republic of Crimea, including  federal city Simferopol, opened hotline where citizens returning from countries where coronavirus was registered. They can leave their contact information there, and tell which countries they visited, as well as get consultation about the virus. This is health-monitoring policy.

Russia, as of March 10, according to Lipetsk administration's order, "Medical organizations are required to organize their work with the priority of providing medical care at home to patients with respiratory symptoms who have visited the territories where cases of novel coronavirus infection (2019-nCoV) have been registered, and to patients over 60 years old".

In Moscow (Russia) from March 12 the city government conducts audits on businesses to ensure compliance with sanitary/disinfection procedures and medical monitoring (presence of sufficient disinfectants, anti-viral antiseptics, masks, respirators, thermal imagers for contactless thermometry)

description: From March 13, the Government of the Krasnodar Region recommends citizens living and arriving at the territory of the Krasnodar Region, who have visited the country with registered cases of coronavirus infection, to send information about the place and dates of their staying and contact information to the hotline of the Ministry of Health of the Krasnodar Region

Russia: Starting from 13 March 2020, The Republic of Buryatia obliged its  Ministry of Health to observe those patients that have the symptoms of heavy respiratory diseases separately from others, desirably at home.

On March 13, Moscow (Russia) City Hall posts a list of flights requiring passengers to call immediately for medical attention and coronavirus testing via home health visit as an effort to monitor the health of its citizens/residents.

description: On March 14, Moscow (Russia) City Hall posts a list of flights requiring passengers to call immediately for medical attention and coronavirus testing via home health visit as an effort to monitor the health of its citizens/residents.

description: In Moscow (Russia) the mayor issues an order on March 14 requiring employers to monitor the health of employees by ensuring that those in quarantine do not come to work in addition to those with coronavirus symptoms fever, cough and shortness of breath.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Russia, Nizhny Novgorod: citizens who arrive from countries with registered cases of COVID-19 should inform about their arrival and contact information to Nizhny Novgorod Regional Center for Disaster Medicine hotline starting from March 14
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: In city medical clinics in Moscow (Russia) as a health monitoring measure, temperature checks are instituted at building entrances beginning March 14. Those with elevated temperatures are given masks and sent to a separate entrance if possible.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: The government of the Republic of Ingushetia (Russia) announced on March 14 that people arriving from abroad were being medically examined on a daily basis.

from March 15, the government of the Volgograd region recommends to employers operating in the Volgograd region to ensure the measurement of body temperature to workers at workplaces with the obligatory suspension of persons with fever

From March 15 2020, Russia, Pscov region has recommended to its citizens, who earlier had visited countries with registered Covid-19 immediately say about their arrival to Russia, place, dates of stay in the indicated territories, their contact information on the hotline telephone number of the Health Committee of the Pskov region no later than 14 days from the date of arrival in the Russian Federation.

On March 15, 2020, the head of the Komi Republic declares that citizens arriving from countries with unstable virus situation should report on their current location and details of their trip to the government.

From March 15 2020, Pscov region, Russia, has recommended to its citizens who recently visited countries with registered Covid-19 to immediately seek medical help by calling a medical worker at home without visiting medical organizations if signs of an infectious disease appear (fever, cough, etc.).

As of March 15, 2020, the head of Komi encourages all employers to monitor workers' health conditions ( i.e. body temperature) and provide information on employees with confirmed COVID-19 to the Rospotrebnadzor by request.

All residents returning from countries where cases of coronavirus have been reported are taken under observation and tested. This practice is also extended to those who come from holidays from the countries of Southeast Asia.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: On March 16, Moscow (Russia) City Hall posts a list of flights requiring passengers to call immediately for medical attention and coronavirus testing via home health visit as an effort to monitor the health of its citizens/residents.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: In the Altai Republic (of the Russian Federation), 16 March 2020, registration of cases of community-onset pneumonia continues, each patient is checked for the coronavirus.

From March 16 2020, Russia, Murmansk region recommends to its citizens who have visited territories outside the Russian Federation where cases of coronavirus infection have been registered that if signs of an infectious disease appear (fever, cough, etc.), immediately seek medical help at home with a call from a medical worker without visiting medical organizations.

From March 16 2020, Russia, Murmansk region recommends  to citizens who have visited territories outside the Russian Federation where cases of coronavirus infection have been registered to immediately inform about their return to the Russian Federation, place, dates of stay in the territories with Covid-19.

On March 16, the Deputy chairman of Krasnoyarskiy Krai Alexey Podkorytov added that the entire necessary volume of urgent medical measuresfor health monitoring is being carried out in the Krasnoyarsk Territory, three medical bases have been prepared for the hospitalization of citizens who have contacted with those who have been diagnosed with signs of coronavirus infection.

In the Tver region, Russia, on March 16, 2020, a hotline has been organized to monitor the health conditions of residents returning from countries, where cases of a new coronavirus infection (2019-nCoV) have been reported.
Magadan Government strengthened health monitoring by creating hotline  to report passenger's arrival information, travel details, and contact information starting from March 16

Ingushetia’s Presidential Decree of March 17 recommended employers operating in the region to provide measurement of body temperature for employees at the workplace. Persons with fever must be suspended from being at the workplace.

Russia"recommends organizations carrying out educational activities on the territory of the Orenburg region according to preschool education programs:
carrying out activities to identify pupils with signs of respiratory diseases, through conducting daily morning examinations of pupils' body temperature by medical workers and preventing those pupils from being in the organizations." The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

From March 16 2020, Russia, Murmansk region recommend to employers operating on the territory of the Murmansk region, starting from 00.00 hours 03/17/2020 until special instructions to take measures aimed at identifying workers with signs of colds (fever, cough, etc.) and preventing such employees from being in the workplace, immediate referral of employees to medical organizations when symptoms are detected.
Starting from March 17, employers in Omsk have to measure the body temperature of their employees. In case if a person has an increased body temperature he or she must leave the workplace.
Tomsk Region, Russia, enforced preventive measures and protective measures at Bogashevo Airport from March 17.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,New (COVID-19 specific) Task Force

description:
Russia " recommends <U+0441>itizens arriving in the Orenburg region from countries where new cases of coronavirus infection (COVID-19) are registered, according to the information posted on the World Health Organization website in the Internet information and telecommunication network (www.who.int):
immediately inform about their return, place, dates of stay in the territories of the countries specified in this subparagraph, contact information by telephone of the "hot line" of the Ministry of Health of the Orenburg Region (8-800-200-56-03, 8 (3532) 44-89- 38), Office of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Well-Being in the Orenburg Region (8-800-555-49-43, 8 (3532) 44-23-51, 44 -23-54) , Federal Center for Healthcare "Center for Hygiene and Epidemiology in the Orenburg Region" (8 (3532) 77-31-64)" The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

Starting from the 17th of March Sakha,the region of Russian Federation, is recomending its citizens who traveled to countries that have registered COVID 19 cases to contact Ministry of Health of Sakha
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
Russia "recommends to organizations carrying out educational activities in the Orenburg region, providing primary general, basic general, secondary general and secondary vocational education:
to carry out measures to identify students with signs of respiratory diseases and to prevent such students from being in these organizations."
The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

On March 17, Moscow (Russia) City Hall posts a list of flights requiring passengers to call immediately for medical attention and coronavirus testing via home health visit as an effort to monitor the health of its citizens/residents.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Russia “obliges the Ministry of Health of the Orenburg region to provide with:
organization of the work of medical organizations of the state health care system of the Orenburg region for the daily observation of citizens who arrived in the Orenburg region from countries where cases of a new coronavirus infection (COVID-19) and citizens living with them have been registered, within 14 calendar days from the moment of return to the Russian Federation of territories with registered cases of coronavirus infection." The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

Russia "recommends employers operating in the Orenburg region: to carry out activities aimed at identifying workers with signs of a respiratory illness, including fever, and preventing the presence of such workers in the workplace". The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

Starting from March 17, the government of Crimea along with federal authorities, will track down people coming from countries with many cases of coronavirus. In addition, employers have to measure the body temperature of their employees.
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Justice,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: Starting from March 17, all employers of Kostroma region must measure body temperature of their employees per order of the governor of the region until further notice. In case it is higher than 37, they must be sent back home.
Starting from 17 of March, all employers of Kaluga region must check body temperatures of their employees.

In Mariy-El, since March 17, residents who have visited the territories where cases of new coronavirus infection have been registered must inform about their return to the Mariy-El, place, dates of stay in these territories, contact information on the hotline of the Republic of Mari El.

Ingushetia’s Presidential Decree of March 17 instructed employers to immediately provide information on all contacts of employees with a reported coronavirus infection upon receiving a request from the Office of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Well-Being in the Republic of Ingushetia.

Starting from the 17th of March Sakha, the region of Russian Federation, is recommending its citizens who traveled to countries that have registered COVID 19 cases to ask for medical help in the case if they are experiencing respiratory issues. Regional government recommends to ask for medical help at home and asks not to go to medical organizations.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In his Decree of March 17, the president of Ingushetia (Russia) ordered the Ministry of Health of Ingushetia to launch a hotline for citizens who have returned from territories with reported cases of the coronavirus to report the places of their visit, dates of their departure and return, and contact information.

Russia "recommends employers working in the Orenburg region: upon receipt of a request from the Office of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Well-Being in the Orenburg Region, immediately provide information on all contacts of an employee who has a coronavirus infection in connection with his labor functions". The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 17.

Starting from March 17, all people entering Kostroma region from countries where cases of COVID-19 were registered must inform authorities of their whereabouts, their contact information, dates when they were in foreign countries and places where they stayed. In case they have symptoms of the COVID-19, they must alert authorities immediately.

On March 18, head of the Republic of Mordovia (Russia) recommends people arriving from countries where COVID-19 cases were registered to inform about dates and places of their stay in these countries and provide their contact information through the hotline of healthcare institution "ambulance station" and self-isolate for 14 days after arrival (without attending work, school, and minimizing visits of public places) and comply with the regulations of sanitary doctors about being in isolation mode. In case of appearance of symptoms of respiratory diseases, patients immediately need to seek medical help at home without visiting medical organizations.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description: In the Altai Republic of the Russian Federation, 18 March 2020, Khorokhordin announced that every person coming to the Altai Republic from other regions is obliged to comply with a two-week quarantine

Startting from 18 of March, all travelers who visited countries with  COVID-19 cases, will have to report their presence to the authorities of Smolensk region, inform them about people they contacted with, details about their trip and will have to undergo 14-day quarantine.

On March 18 2020, Russia, Sverdlovsk obliged its residents  who visited in February-March 2020 the territories where cases of covid-19 were registered to inform about their return to the Sverdlovsk region, place, dates of stay in the indicated territories and contact information on the hotline of the Sverdlovsk region.

On March 19 2020, Russia, Transbaikal region recommended to its citizens when the first signs of a respiratory infection appear, to stay at home (at the place of stay) and immediately in the telephone mode, that is, without visiting medical organizations, contact the medical organization.
Measurement of body temperature for workers should be provided at workplaces with the obligatory suspension of persons with an elevated temperature from being at the workplace from March 10, 2020.

Decree of the Governor of the Primorsky Territory of March 18, 2020 No. 21-pg: Recommend to citizens who have visited territories where, in accordance with the information on the website of the World Organization, cases of new coronavirus infection have been registered:
notify about your return to the Russian Federation, place, dates of stay in the specified territories
when the first signs of an infectious disease appear, immediately seek medical help by calling a medical professional at home

Issuing an order from March 17, the Governor of Omsk recommens that citizens returning from territories where new cases of coronavirus infection (COVID-19) have been reported inform their arrival in the Omsk region, location, dates of stay in the territories mentioned above, contact information on the “hotline”.

On March 18 2020, Russia, Sverdlovsk region obliged its residents who visited in February-March 2020 the territories where cases of covid-19 were registered, to immediately seek medical help at home without visiting medical organizations and comply with the orders of sanitary doctors about being in isolation at home when the first respiratory symptoms appear.
Starting March 18, 2020, Ivanovo region(Russia) enforces daily temperature screening of citizens and mandatory isolation of citizens with high body temperature

Starting March 18 in the Tambov region of Russia, citizens who have returned from territories where new cases of coronavirus infection have been registered are required to report this to the regional health department hotline by phone number 8 (4752) 45-45-86.

On March 18, government of Chelyabinsk oblast (Russia) recommends citizens arriving from countries where COVID-19 cases were registered 1) to inform about dates and places of their stay in these countries and provide their contact information for health monitoring through the hotline of Ministry of Health and regional Rospotrebnadzor 2) self-isolate for 14 days after arrival (without attending work, school, and minimizing visits of public places) 3) comply with the recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor about being in self-isolation. In case of appearance of symptoms of respiratory diseases, patients immediately need to seek medical help at home without visiting medical organizations.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
On March 18, Head of the Republic of Mordovia (Russia) recommends employers 
1) to conduct body temperature checks of employees in the workplace with mandatory suspension from the workplace of people with elevated temperature 
2) to send information to the Office of the Federal service for supervision of consumer rights protection and human welfare in the Republic of Mordovia on cases of suspension from the workplace of persons with elevated body temperature 
3) upon a request from the Office of the Federal service for supervision of consumer rights protection and human welfare in the Republic of Mordovia, immediately provide information about all contacts of a person who has COVID-2019.

On March 18 2020,Russia recommended to citizens living in the Trans-Baikal Territory and (or) arriving in the Trans-Baikal Territory from countries where cases of covid-19 have been registered to immediately notify about their return, place, dates of stay in the indicated territories, address of place of residence,and contact information on a single emergency number "112".

Medical surveillance in Khanty-Mansia region should be organized for persons who visited countries epidemiologically unfavorable according to COVID-2019 in the last 14 days before the onset of symptoms
Beginning March 18, 2020, Ivanovo region(Russia) recommends citizens, who develop symptoms, to contact primary health care services without visiting.

Decree of the Governor of the Primorsky Territory of March 18, 2020 No. 21-pg: to recommend federal educational organizations to carry out activities to identify students with signs of an infectious disease and to prevent such students from being in the educational organization.

On March 19 2020, Russia, Oryol region organized a hotline of the Department of Health of the Oryol Region on new coronavirus infection (COVID-19).
From March 19, 2020, Russia, Oryol region obliged the Department of Health of the Oryol Region to organize the work of medical organizations with the priority of providing medical care at home.

Russia, Murmansk region, creates municipal operational headquarters to implement measures for the prevention and control of the spread of coronavirus infection in the municipalities of the Murmansk region, whose tasks include, among other things, analyzing the situation related to the spread of coronavirus infection and submitting relevant information to the Interdepartmental Operational Headquarters, daily, until 20.00, starting from 03/19/2020.

In the Altai Republic of the Russian Federation, 19 March 2020, all citizens coming from countries heavily affected by the coronavirus should report on their arrival by contacting the hotline (913) 629 9074.

From March 19, 2020, the Tver city administration will monitor the health conditions of citizens arriving from abroad.

Starting from March 19, in North Ossetia employers are required to provide body temperature measurements for employees of organizations, enterprises and institutions.

In the Altai Republic of the Russian Federation, 19 March 2020, all citizens coming from countries heavily affected by the coronavirus should report on their arrival by contacting the hotline (913) 629 9074, stay home for fourteen days under the supervision of medical workers, not to go to their workplace and place of study, minimize communication with relatives and friends, when the symptoms of the disease appear, immediately consult a doctor.

The Vologda region, Russia, on March 20, 2020, decided on strict monitor over the self-isolation regime of Russians and foreigners arriving from abroad. To control the self-isolation regime, Vologda residents will be monitored by 100 mobile groups from the Ministry of Internal Affairs, Rosgvardia and social workers.

description: As of March 23, in Lipetsk oblast, "Social workers regularly measure the body temperature of the pensioners" and provide basic medical care.

In the Vologda Region, Russia, all individuals who returned from countries with registered cases of coronavirus , will be monitored through the hotline on coronavirus infection starting from March 23.

From March 23, all employers operating in the territory of Kamchatka krai (Russia) must provide body temperature measurements for employees in the workplace with mandatory suspension from the workplace of people with elevated temperature.

On March 24, in Krasnoyarskiy region tests for coronavirus will start to be taken from people who have arrived from countries which have cases of coronavirus, as well as from persons who have been in contact with those infected with COVID-19. Analyzes of those who were diagnosed with pneumonia by doctors are also subject to research.

The Main Control of Regional Security announces that officials of police, RosPotrebNadzor, and medical workers are checking up on people who were in contact with infected individuals, and in necessary cases, the individuals showing signs of the virus are being taken from homes to hospitals, the press office informs on March 24

description: In the Yaroslavl Region, as of March 24, healthcare workers and police officers monitor all individuals who have returned from countries, where coronavirus infection has been recorded. They are conducting raids to check if the self-isolation regime is followed.

In Moscow (Russia), coronavirus patients with mild cases begin to be treated at home from March 23. Home treatment utilizes a round-the-clock  telemedicine technology center that connects patients using audio and video communications. Patients sign an informed consent and commit to self-isolation. Patient intake is conducted by an ambulance doctors who  takes a photograph of the patient and submits it to the database of the video surveillance system
In Yaroslavl, Russia, from March 27 to April 14, police officers carry out house raids to see if the elderly people violate the governor's decree on self-isolation.

Russia: Starting from 27 March 2020, The Republic of Buryatia ordered employers to health monitor their employees, and do not give access to the ones that have the symptoms like high temperature, sore throat, etc.

Russia: Starting from 27 March 2020, The Republic of Buryatia ordered to ensure that laboratory tests are carried out for all persons who have returned from foreign trips within a month and have sought medical help for the onset of symptoms of colds.

The government of the Rostov Region obliged the employers to immediately provide information on all contacts of a person who has a novel coronavirus infection (2019-nCoV) in connection with his performance of labor functions

The government of the Rostov Region orders to organize the work of medical organizations with the priority of providing medical care at home for febrile patients with respiratory symptoms who have visited territories where cases of a new coronavirus infection (2019-nCoV) have been registered, and for patients over the age of 60, for which to ensure the strengthening of the outpatient service by employees of prevention departments, phthisiatric service and clinical residents of educational institutions of higher education.

According to the order of the Head of Republic of Kalmykiya, starting from March 27, it has been ordered to oblige employers operating in the Republic of Kalmykia to provide body temperature measurement to employees in the workplace with mandatory removal from the workplace of persons with elevated temperature and symptoms of SARS.
In the Irkutsk region, older people are asked to visit shops in the morning from 9:00 to 11:00

The government of the Rostov region orders the heads of Administration of Urban Districts and Municipal Areas to inform citizens of age 65 and over about their accompanying social workers (full Name and phone number)

The government of the Rostov region orders the heads of Administration of Urban Districts and Municipal Areas to monitor compliance with self-isolation of citizens over the age of 65 and citizens who recently returned from abroad.

According to the Order Of the Governor of the Ryazan region Nikolay Lyubimov on 28th March to the Ministry of labor and social protection of the population of the Ryazan region: provide strengthening of the anti-epidemic regime (conducting thermometry and examination in order to identify patients, strengthening control over compliance with the temperature regime, current disinfection modes, air disinfection, wearing protective masks, etc.) in subordinate institutions with round-the-clock stay;

On March 29 2020, Russia, Perm region obliged citizens who arrived on the territory of the Perm Territory from foreign states when the first respiratory symptoms appear, immediately seek medical help at home without visiting medical organizations.

On March 29 2020, Russia, Perm region obliged all employers operating in the Perm Territory to immediately provide information on all contacts of a patient with COVID-19 in connection with the performance of his labor functions, and also ensure the disinfection of the premises where the sick person was.

Russia, Penza region: starting from March 30 for patients over 45 years old with diabetes mellitus and diseases of the circulatory system, call centers have been organized, by calling which they will be able to get advice from a specialized doctor.

Sergey Galkin, the Head of the Russian Ministry of Internal Affairs’ Administration for the Tula Region (Russia), reported on March 30 that police officers and doctors daily monitor health conditions of the citizens of the Tula Region self-isolating at home after arriving to the region as well as their compliance with quarantine measures (Health Monitoring).

description: The government of the Rostov Region announces preventive measures are organized to identify diseases of the circulatory system and oncological diseases that form the main causes of mortality in the population.
Russia introduces a new electronic form and registration via mobile phone to track those (citizens) coming into the country and monitor their quarantine/isolation from March 30.
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police

description: According to news published in the official website of Kurgan government on March 30, Deputy Director of the Department of Health of Kurgan oblast Elena Ostrovsky points out the enforcement of health monitoring for the people who have returned from overseas and the people who had close contact with them. "Currently 1700 people are under surveillance".

The Russian legislature passes amendments to the administrative and criminal codes on March 31 classifying violations related to epidemiological safety, states of alert or emergency, and the spread of misinformation related to such situations as administrative and/or criminal offenses with increasing punishments if said violations lead to deaths.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied)

description: A decree signed by the Head of the Chechen Republic (Russia) on March 31 concerns urgent measures to prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection in the territory of the Chechen Republic. It states that "citizens arriving to the Chechen Republic from other regions of Russia where cases of the disease were identified are required to inform their place of stay, dates of travel to outside territories, and contact information on the hotline of the Ministry of Health of the Chechen Republic. They are required to comply with the regulations on being in isolation."

Russia "obliges the executive authorities of the Orenburg region in cooperation with the Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of the Russian Federation in the Orenburg region, the Department of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Welfare in the Orenburg Region, the Orenburg Line Department of the Ministry of Internal Affairs of Russia for Transport, the South Ural Territorial Department of the Federal services for supervision in the field of protection of consumer rights and human well-being in rail transport in order to register persons entering the territory of the Orenburg region, to control their temperature, organize control points at the airports of the cities of Orenburg and Orsk, at railway stations located in the Orenburg region, automobile federal, regional and local highways." The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from March 31.
Starting from April 2, Crimea will check the health condition of all people coming to the republic from other regions of Russia

On March 2, The Governor of Moscow oblast announced that infected people on the lockdown will be monitored with the help of electronic technology that tracks the geolocation of a person. The relatives, families, and all people in contact with the infected will also be monitored

In Vologda region, Russia, as of April 1, 2020, officials decided on total control over transit transport arriving in the Vologda region from other regions and going through the territory of the region.
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description: The Government of the Tula Region (Russia) announced on April 4 that the Ministry of Health of the Tula Region has organized a hotline for the elderly persons and residents with chronic diseases who may report their health condition and seek medical advice by calling 8-800-200-27-72 (from 9:00 to 18:00 on weekdays) (Health Monitoring).
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time

description: Starting from April 10, all employers working in Smolensk region will have to measure body temperature of their employees. In case it is higher than 37 degress, they should be immdeiately sent to the nearest hospital.

Russia "obliges citizens of the Russian Federation, foreign citizens, stateless persons who arrived on the territory of the Orenburg region from foreign states or other subjects of the Russian Federation:
when entering the territory of the Orenburg region, fill out a questionnaire, indicating information about the place of residence (stay) in the territory of the region and a contact phone number." The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from April 4.

Starting on April 5, testing for Covid-19 will be available for all patients with respiratory diseases in the Vladimir region (Russia). According to the decree No. 182 dated 04/05/2020, Director of the Department of Health of the Administration in the Vladimir Region, Alexei Mozalev, all patients with SARS, influenza, bronchitis, community-acquired pneumonia are now considered as potentially infected with Covid-19. Medical organizations of the region are ordered to provide care for such patients at home, excluding their visits to medical organizations, organize a collection of tests for them at Covid-19, urgently inform the regional department of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Welfare on patients with symptoms of respiratory diseases. Respiratory patients will be treated on an outpatient basis. Only patients with a severe clinical picture and an atypical course of diseases will be sent to hospitalization.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Minister of Health of the Tula Region (Russia) announced on April 6 that 114 physicians and more than 150 students of the Medical College of the Medical Institute of Tula State University have been assigned to make calls to all citizens of the region over the age of 65 to monitor their health conditions (Health Monitoring).
type_sub_cat: A snapshot of a person’s health at a given point in time

description: The Department of International and Regional Relations of the Tomsk Region Administration maintains a register of residents of the region who are outside of Russia from April 8.

description: Until April 19, residents of the Tomsk region over 65 who continue to work can go on a two-week self-isolation, having drawn up a sick leave.

Their temperature should be checked.
Starting from April 12, all people entering Vyazem town must pass through temperature check. In case they have a fever of 37 and higher, they will be sent to nearby hospital.

Valery Sherin, Head of the Government of the Tula Region (Russia), reported on April 13 that measuring the body temperature of passengers at railway and bus stations using automatic devices had been organized.

description: Russia: Starting from 21 April 2020, The Republic of Buryatia recommended the ministries to organize health monitoring (temperature check) at the entrance posts to the territory of the Republic of Buryatia.

description: On April 23, the Ministry of Health of Krasnoyarskiy Krai informed that an information system for keeping electronic diaries was launched in the region. Citizens who are at home in self-isolation under the supervision of polyclinics will record data on the symptoms characteristic of coronavirus infection. As a result, their health condition will be constantly monitored by doctors of polyclinics.

Starting from 23.04, all people entering the town of Gagarinsk in Smolensk region will have to checked for high fever. In case it is higher than 37, they should be directed to the nearby hospital. This is the order of Smolensk governor.

description: Starting April 24 in the Tambov region of Russia, restrictive measures are tightened for citizens arriving in the Tambov region from Moscow, the Moscow region, and St. Petersburg. Citizens need to notify local governments about their arrival and if experiencing respiratory symptoms they need to immediately contact medical organizations without visiting them. In addition to this, citizens are required to observe a 14-day self-isolation regime at home. If these restrictions are not observed, citizens may be held liable up to criminal liability.

description: Russia "obliges the Ministry of Construction, Housing and Utilities, Roads and Transport of the Orenburg Region, together with organizations and individual entrepreneurs that carry out inter-municipal transportation of passengers and luggage in a passenger taxi, to organize a registration of persons carrying out inter-communal trips with the provision of a questionnaire survey of persons, control whether employees have funds personal protection, current disinfection mode." The health monitoring policy takes effect starting from April 30.

description: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, people who are 65 and older must self-isolate. Employees aged 65+ who did not go on vacation for this period and do not work remotely can receive a third electronic sick leave during the pandemic for the days from May 12 to May 29. In this case, the employer must provide additional measures for them to prevent possible infection.

The Chechen Republic (Russian Federation) carried out more than 3500 CT scan tests on COVID-19 free of charge since the start of the pandemic. Around 150 patients are monitored every day in six medical institutions, that work 24/7.

from 21.05, the governor of the Krasnodar Territory obliges organizations and individual entrepreneurs operating in the territory of the Krasnodar Territory: to ensure the measurement of the body temperature of workers at workplaces with the obligatory suspension of persons with an elevated body temperature from being at the workplace;

On May 26, the Ministry of construction industry announced that workers at the construction sites have to get their temperature measured twice a day and maintain a safe distance. Moreover, workers have to regularly wash their hands and keep the public places disinfected. Special stewards will control the execution of these sanitary norms.

On May 27, 2020, the Governor of the Rostov Region orders the heads of the executive authorities of the Rostov region, which are in charge of organizations with a long-term round-the-clock stay of citizens, including for medical purposes (hereinafter referred to as subordinate organizations) to ensure that additional sanitary and anti-epidemic (preventive) measures are taken to prevent the spread of a new coronavirus infection (COVID-19) in subordinate organizations:

On May 27 the Government of the Rostov Region declares additional measures to ensure the sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population and control over the implementation of sanitary and epidemiological (preventive) measures to prevent the spread of a new coronavirus infection (COVID-19) in organizations with a long-term round-the-clock stay of citizens

Russia: Starting from 12 June, The Republic of Buryatia ordered to ensure that a laboratory examination is carried out in the period from the fifth to the tenth day from the date of arrival to all persons who arrived in the territory of the Republic of Buryatia at home (except for the persons who arrived for tourist purposes and who have a certificate of absence coronavirus infection and the absence of contact with citizens with the presence of coronavirus infection in the last 14 days).

On June 15, together with the heads of the municipal districts of the Republic of Sakha and the Ministry of Education and Science of the Republic of Sakha (Yakutia) ensured preventive medical supervision of underage people arriving and staying on the territory of urban or rural settlements during vacation time, including the involvement of medical workers of preschool educational organizations and general education organizations, within 14 calendar days from the date of arrival.

description: Starting on August 19th, foreign citizens arriving to the Vladimir region (Russia) for employment and residence will be tested for Covid-19. Now, foreign citizens, when processing the documents required to obtain a patent or work permit, temporary residence permit, residence permit and must be tested for a coronavirus infection. In addition, when passing a medical examination, foreign citizens are required to pass tests for diseases that pose a danger to others. Among them are drug addiction, tuberculosis, leprosy, syphilis, HIV, asymptomatic infection status caused by the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV).

The lack of essential goods, overpriced and unsanitary conditions in the stores of the Vladimir region (Russia) can be reported to the telephone of a special hotline. All pharmacies in the region will be checked for the availability of drugs for the treatment of infections and the prices for these drugs. The Department for the Development of Entrepreneurship, Trade and the Service Industry opens a special “hotline” by calling 8 (4922) 53-16-03, where you can report stores where essential goods have disappeared from the sale or the price of them has risen. The verification of large trade and public catering facilities in the region to implement these recommendations will be held from March 16 to 24.

On April 18, the Russian government passed a resolution to simplify and speed up the duty-free import of medical products including tests for COVID-19, artificial ventilation devices, medical masks, and protective suits. From March 16 to September 30, such products can be imported without paying customs duties, provided that they are intended for direct transfer to medical institutions. The intended purpose of the goods must be confirmed by a special document. Previously, such documents were issued by regional governments. description: On April 18, the Russian government passed a resolution to simplify and speed up the duty-free import of medical products including tests for COVID-19, artificial ventilation devices, medical masks, and protective suits. From March 16 to September 30, such products can be imported without paying customs duties, provided that they are intended for direct transfer to medical institutions. The intended purpose of the goods must be confirmed by a special document. Previously, such documents were issued by regional governments. Now such powers are also assigned to the Ministry of Industry and Trade and the Ministry of Health.

Russia "continues the construction of a new multifunctional medical center in the Orenburg region.
On March 20, in the regional center on the territory of the hospital on Parkovoy Avenue, the construction of a two-story multifunctional medical center for 60 beds began. This is one of the centers that are currently being built on behalf of the President of Russia and the order of the Minister of Defense in different regions of the country.
In addition to the medical center itself, a free-standing car disinfection point is also being erected, as well as a sewage treatment station. In addition, military builders will carry out landscaping work: the green area will be 2825 m2.
In parallel with the construction, the supply of medical equipment was organized: computer tomographs, anesthesiology devices, endoscopy, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, and X-ray complexes. A stock of medicines is being formed. Medical personnel are undergoing advanced training courses at the S.M. Kirov in St. Petersburg." The health resources policy takes effect starting from March 20.

Russia "continues the construction of a new multifunctional medical center in the Orenburg region.
On March 20, in the regional center on the territory of the hospital on Parkovoy Avenue, the construction of a two-story multifunctional medical center for 60 beds began. This is one of the centers that are currently being built on behalf of the President of Russia and the order of the Minister of Defense in different regions of the country.
In addition to the medical center itself, a free-standing car disinfection point is also being erected, as well as a sewage treatment station. In addition, military builders will carry out landscaping work: the green area will be 2825 m2.
In parallel with the construction, the supply of medical equipment was organized: computer tomographs, anesthesiology devices, endoscopy, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation, and X-ray complexes. A stock of medicines is being formed. Medical personnel are undergoing advanced training courses at the S.M. Kirov in St. Petersburg." The health resources policy takes effect starting from March 20.

description:
Governor of Krasnoyarskiy Krai Alexander Uss recommended the leadership of large financial and industrial groups operating in the Krasnoyarsk Territory to help regional medical institutions in purchasing expensive diagnostic equipment.

Acting within the framework of the agreements reached, SUEK has already purchased two mobile modern digital X-ray machines with a total value of almost 100 thousand euros. At the moment, the devices have been transferred to the Krasnoyarsk Interdistrict Clinical Emergency Hospital named after N.S. Karpovich. The company also continues to search for artificial lung ventilation devices and other equipment for medical institutions in the region.

The Norilsk Nickel company has undertaken to pay for the purchase of 20 artificial lung ventilation devices, 20 patient monitors, 4 digital X-ray machines and other medical equipment and supplies for a total of 120 million rubles for medical institutions in the region, including the city of Norilsk.

The RUSAL company is actively looking for protective and disinfectants, non-contact thermometers for medical institutions and pharmacies in the region. Many products were found abroad. The procedure for their acquisition is agreed with the Russian Ministry of Health.

The Polyus company has delivered to Krasnoyarsk about 1000 Russian-Japanese express tests for the diagnosis of COVID-19.

The Russian Ministry of Health on April 8 directs that medical waste generated during the treatment of COVID-19 should be managed as class B medical waste for the collection of waste, methods and method of disinfection, temporary storage and transportation. Class B medical waste includes: Materials in contact with patients with infectious diseases; wastes from laboratories, pharmaceutical and immunobiological productions working with microorganisms of 1-2 groups of pathogenicity; Wastes from the medical and diagnostic units of tuberculosis hospitals (dispensaries), contaminated by sputum of patients, wastes from microbiological laboratories

description:
Russia" more than 1,700 volunteers take part in the #WeTogether in Orenburg region
In the Orenburg region, more than 1,700 Orenburg residents joined the work of the #WeVaTogether campaign headquarters.
 A regional "hot line" 8-800-200-56-03 for assistance to elderly people over 65 has been organized.
In the conditions of self-isolation, Lyubov Vershinina, a resident of Orenburg, also began to sew masks and pass them on to those in need through volunteers. Now Lyubov Nikolaevna sews 20-30 reusable masks every day. The need for Orenburg residents in medical masks is also covered by a volunteer assistant Valery Melnikov.
Young entrepreneurs Denis Sazonov and Vladimir Kirchev handed over a thousand pieces of disposable gloves to volunteers, which run out very quickly. On a day, volunteers of field groups need from 50 to 100 pieces of disposable masks and the same number of pairs of gloves.
Popular Front activists Andrei Mazhartsev and Sergei Kotelnikov, as well as the electric locomotive driver Igor Somov, who joined the ONF, deliver food kits and medicines to pensioners in their cars. Volunteers Zakhid Ganiev, Roman Lukashin and Geigar Gapoyan also offered their shoulder to the elderly. " The health resources policy takes effect starting from April 13.

description:
Russia "Two hospitals in the Orenburg region received cars for visits to patients
Today, April 16, the chief doctors of the Oktyabrskaya and Orenburg regional hospitals received the keys to two new cars. Fully equipped with everything necessary for work, the machines are designed for prompt delivery of doctors to patients, delivery of preferential drugs and prescriptions, and collection of tests.
As the secretary of the General Council of the party Andrei Turchak said earlier, the cars were purchased with the funds saved from the reduction of administrative and organizational costs of the party, as well as the costs of preparing and holding elections. In the near future, the cars will be transferred to all regions of the country." The health resources policy takes effect starting from April 16.
Russia, Nizhny Novgorod: Doctors and medical staff working with Covid patients will be placed in 25 hotels from April 16

On April 16, the Russian Ministry of Health recommends that regional health care systems consider whether they should temporarily suspend childhood vaccination programs and what precautions might be necessary if the programs go forward. This measure is meant to divert health care resources to the care of coronavirus patients and to prevent further spread.

Russia "Orenburg health insurance community helps volunteers
On a daily basis, specialists from insurance companies contact insured residents of Orenburg who are at risk. They inform citizens over the age of 60 about the need to comply with the self-isolation regime, the main symptoms caused by the coronavirus, and also remind them of useful hotlines.

Insurance representatives also talk about how to get help from volunteers to deliver food and medicine to people in self-isolation. With the consent of the residents of Orenburg, insurance representatives themselves transfer their contact details to the volunteer headquarters for communication.

The Orenburg branch of the insurance medical organization "Capital MS" together with the All-Russian People's Front helps the elderly and those who have found themselves in a difficult life situation. Insurance representatives buy grocery baskets and deliver them to citizens' homes in compliance with all epidemiological standards.

In addition, together with the Orenburg entrepreneur, hot meals are delivered for the employees of the laboratory of GAUZ "GKB No. 3" in Orenburg, who conduct analyzes to detect COVID-19, as well as ambulance teams that go to Orenburg residents with suspected coronavirus." The health resources policy takes effect starting from April 16.

description: In Russia, the Magadan government set a task to equip 40 beds for patients with coronavirus starting from April 27

Since April 27, all stationary social service organizations in the Vladimir region (Russia) are switching to a closed round-the-clock mode with a change of workers once every two weeks. The relevant Decree to prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection was signed by Governor Vladimir Sipyagin. Additional quarantine measures cover all state social service institutions providing stationary social services: neuropsychiatric boarding schools, nursing homes for the elderly and disabled, gerontological centers, comprehensive social services centers. Throughout the entire period of work in a closed round-the-clock period, constant medical monitoring of the state of health of the recipients of social services and employees of institutions will be provided, including, if necessary, narrow specialists will be involved.

According to the Order of the Governor of Ryazan oblast on April 23, starting from April 27, 2020, and until further notice, it is ordered to ensure that medical organizations suspend the planned admission of patients in polyclinics by district therapists and narrow specialists, as well as organize the work of outpatient emergency services (mainly at home).

The Russian Ministry of Health announces on April 27 that the first license for production of biomedical cell products is issued in Russia by the Federal Service for Surveillance in Healthcare to a Russian pharmaceutical company. Biomedical cell products can be autologous (related), allogeneic (non-related), and combined.  Allogeneic products are widely studied and used worldwide for the treatment of systemic diseases, such as gonarthrosis, cardiovascular diseases, gastrointestinal diseases, and severe life-threatening conditions, such as acute myocardial infarction or ARDS, which is one of the main complications in severe COVID -19.

description:
On April 28, the headquarters of the Kurgan region reports, the purchase of medical equipment for the treatment of patients with coronavirus continues in the Trans-Urals. Currently, the infectious diseases hospital already has 93 mechanical ventilation devices.

“Today, 18 additional devices are being supplied, and by the end of the month, within the framework of agreements, we will receive another 34 ventilators,” said Larisa Kokorina, director of the Kurgan Region Health Department.

description:
The Russian Ministry of Health announced on April 28 that it has approved clinical trials of a drug for the treatment of COVID-19. The Russian Ministry of Health issued a permit to a Russian pharmaceutical manufacturer to conduct an adaptive multicenter randomized open comparative clinical trial of the efficacy and safety of the antiviral drug favipiravir in patients hospitalized with COVID-19. A clinical study will be held in 17 medical institutions in several regions of Russia. 

Favipiravir is a chemical that is used as an antiviral drug against various types of RNA viruses. The drug was developed as an anti-influenza drug with effectiveness against severe infections caused by high viral load, and was previously approved as an influenza drug in Japan. According to Chinese scientists, the drug has been shown to be effective in treating patients with COVID-19.

On the 16th of April, The head of Udmurtia announced that within the framework of the new coronavirus task force, additional beds should be deployed in Udmurtia in accordance with the instructions of the Russian Ministry of Health by April 28, making the total number of beds 935.

On April 28, the Ministry of Investment and Science of Moscow oblast announced that research-production company "<U+0413><U+0440><U+0430><U+0441><U+0438><U+0441>" has signed a contract with Moscow oblast's Ministry of Health. According to this contract, the company will produce 300 <U+0410><U+041A><U+0421>-1 medical oxygen concentrates for the oblast.

On April 29, employees of medical institutions who are involved in providing medical care to patients with coronavirus disease will receive additional payments.The document was signed by the Ministry of Health of Krasnoyarskiy Krai. 

At the expense of the federal budget, 430.4 million rubles are provided for 3 months. Additionally, at the expense of the regional budget, 45 million rubles will be allocated monthly for incentive payments to medical and non-medical personnel who provide medical care.

Thus, in April, the salary, taking into account incentive payments, depending on the place of work: a hospital, an ambulance or a polyclinic, for example, for doctors, will be about 167-297 thousand rubles, including 84-213 thousand rubles of incentive payments. The salary of nursing staff is from 90 - 166 thousand rubles, junior from 60.5 - 111 thousand rubles, depending on the hours worked. About 1,500 employees will receive higher wages in May.

The orphanage houses in the Vladimir region (Russia) switched to a closed round-the-clock mode. To prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection in the Vladimir region, starting on 1st May 9 state institutions for orphans and children left without parental care were transferred to a closed round-the-clock mode of operation. 260 children live in them, the total number of employees is 446 people. Their employees work continuously for 14 days. Before embarking on a shift, all employees of the new shift are analyzed at COVID-2019. Throughout the entire period of work in a closed round-the-clock period, constant medical supervision of the health status of pupils and employees of institutions will be provided, including narrow specialists will be involved if necessary.

On May 27, the Ministry of Health of Russia approved guidelines for coding cause of death in morbidity statistics related to COVID-19. The recommendations are based on new principles established by the World Health Organization's International Classification of Diseases (ICD-10), taking into account the International Guidelines for the identification and coding of COVID-19 as the cause of death. The approaches to coding and selection of cause of death, proposed in recommendations approved by the Ministry of Health, are based on a thorough study of the course of COVID-19 and its effect on the body as a whole and will provide the most relevant, objective and detailed statistics about this disease.

On May 28, the Russian Ministry of Health issued a statement about the use of hydroxychloroquine in COVID-19 patients. Based on the results of numerous foreign studies confirming the effectiveness of the drug in experiments and critical trials, as well as expert opinions on the effectiveness and safety of hydroxychloroquine. The use and safety of this and other drugs used in Russia for the treatment of COVID-19 are under the constant supervision of the Russian Ministry of Health and its subordinate organizations.

Funds will be allocated from the budget of the Chechen Republic for the temporary accommodation of about 600 health workers in Grozny hotels. This was announced by the Chairman of the Government of the Chechen Republic Muslim Khuchiev. “In order to protect the families of the medical staff providing care for patients with COVID-19, and in order to reduce the risks of the spread of infection, 25 million rubles will be allocated from the regional budget to accommodate about 600 health workers in the hotels in Grozny - Tiinalla, Berkat, Zama and 4 seasons. Doctors will be provided with comfortable living conditions, three meals a day, as well as transportation to the place of work and back."

The reconstruction is carried out taking into account the requirements for combating COVID-19. The project provides for clear routing of patients and zoning of space in a medical institution. The commissioning of the facility will allow more than 350 patients to be hospitalized simultaneously.

description: Starting on June 1st, a new infectious disease hospital has been opened in Grozny (Chechnya, Russia) at the Russian Children's Clinical Hospital. E. Glinka. A new standard infectious disease hospital has 100 places in Grozny. The medical institution will operate on the basis of the Republican Children's Clinical Hospital (RCCH) named after E. Glinka. The new building includes five departments: reception and diagnostic, airborne, intestinal infections, resuscitation, and intensive care, as well as an LHC laboratory. The building meets all European medical standards and is equipped with the most modern equipment.

description: Starting on June 4, patients in the region may receive a “tele-medical” consultation in the Vladimir region (Russia). To improve the availability and quality of consultative and diagnostic medical care for the population in the context of the spread of Covid-19 and to limit outpatient admission, the Department of Health of the Vladimir Region, together with the Medical Information and Analytical Center, began to implement a pilot telemedicine service. It begins to work on June 5 on the platform of telemedicine consultations onlinedoc.ru, which integrates the patient and the clinic into a single protected circuit. So far, four medical organizations are participating in the project - the Regional Children's Clinical Hospital, the City Clinical Hospital No. 5 of Vladimir, the Murom City Hospital No. 3, and the Yuryev-Polsky Central District Hospital. If successful, other medical facilities will join them. The patient can choose a convenient way to communicate with the doctor - in the format of a phone call, online chat, or video call. During the telemedicine consultation of the patient, the doctor can prescribe drug therapy using the electronic prescription platform, as well as extend or correct previously written electronic prescriptions. This is especially true for patients with chronic diseases who need a constant extension of prescriptions for drugs.
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On July 15th, an additional building for the treatment of patients with COVID-19 is preparing to open in Grozny, Chechnya (Russia). The minister recalled that two buildings of the Republican Rehabilitation Center were commissioned last week, which had previously been re-profiled for the treatment of COVID patients. "In the near future, the Gudermes central regional hospital will be able to return to the regular mode of providing medical care after patients with COVID-19 are discharged," the minister added.

Russia "informs that Orenburg region provides sufficient coverage of the population with testing for new coronavirus infection
Currently, research is carried out not only at the Center for Hygiene and Epidemiology, but also in the laboratory of the City Clinical Hospital No. 3 in the city of Orenburg. And from April 11, another regional laboratory began to function - on the basis of the Orenburg Regional Clinical Blood Transfusion Station.
The laboratory of the City Hospital No. 3 began its work on March 28, 2020, during this time 1,997 laboratory tests were carried out for the presence of the new coronavirus. Work in the laboratory is carried out around the clock in three shifts. All employees are provided with modern personal protective equipment.
The region has a sufficient supply of diagnostic test systems - more than 10 thousand - which is regularly replenished. The test systems registered and used to detect the new coronavirus have the highest possible sensitivity and detect single copies of the virus in the reaction. The data were confirmed both with the use of a live virus in laboratory tests, including abroad, and in research on clinical material." The health testing policy takes effect starting from March 28.

Mask regime is required among employees. Also, tenants are asked to provide the retail space with antiseptics and personal hygiene products for employees.
