description:
From May 1, 2020, hair and beauty salons, enterprises operating in the field of maintenance, electronic and household appliances, and leather goods will be able to resume their activities in the region.
These organizations are obliged to work subject to strict sanitary and epidemiological rules. In particular, in accordance with the recommendations of the Office of Rospotrebnadzor in the Kursk region, beauty salons can work only by appointment, with a minimum number of clients in the hall, carrying out regular disinfection of instruments.

As of May 1, the new policy requires the businesses operating in areas of large crowd concentration and the public transport companies in the Kabardino-Balkaria Republic (Russia) to perform disinfection regularly and 
to ensure that the staff are wearing masks.
Governor Alexander Gusev said on Wednesday, May 6, that a mask regime will be introduced in the Voronezh region. Also, residents of the region are advised to wear gloves.

According to military commissar of the Kursk region Vladimir Rodionov, to minimize the likelihood of infection at all draft boards, all precautions will be observed. This applies to both the mandatory temperature measurement and the exclusion of those with obvious signs of respiratory diseases for examination.
All children will be provided with medical masks and rubber gloves. Disinfectants will be used at draft boards. The draft commissions will resume work on May 6. The first recruits will be sent to the troops by the 20th. It is planned to recruit about 1.5 thousand Kurds.

The press service of the regional government announced that on Tuesday, May 12, a mask regime is going to be introduced in the Voronezh region,. Violators of the mask regime face administrative liability under Art. 20.6.1 of the Code of Administrative Offenses of the Russian Federation (failure to comply with the rules of behavior in an emergency or threat of its occurrence) The amount of the fine for individuals is up to 30 thousand rubles.
Starting from May 12, 2020, all citizens of Saint Petersburg, Russia, are required to wear masks in public places, including taxi, and use hand hygiene products
Since early May of 2020 disinfectors processed 2,539 public facilities with an area of 503 thousand square meters in the Leningrad Region, Russia.
In the Ryazan region, a mandatory mask regime was introduced. The order was signed by Governor Nikolai Lyubimov on may 13.

On May 15, The Government of the Rostov Region orders to approve the Plan of Priority Measures for the phased abolition of restrictive measures in the economic and social sphere of the Rostov Region in the context of the epidemic spread of the novel coronavirus infection (COVID-19) in accordance with the annex. This includes strengthening control over the residents of the Rostov region, who are in their summer cottages, and their compliance with sanitary and epidemiological measures. Disinfection of public spaces, highways in the locations of summer cottages

According to the order of the Head or Republic of Kalmykia on May 19, it has been ordered to heads of administrations of district, city, and rural municipalities of the Republic of Kalmykia, where apartment buildings are located without a form of management, take measures to organize the treatment of common areas and contact surfaces of apartment buildings with disinfectants at intervals that ensure compliance with sanitary and epidemiological requirements.

This policy is effective from May 23, 2020.
Russia, March 26: disinfection of public transport has been strengthened in Penza.

From May 29 2020, Russia, Novgorod region obliged owners and tenants of facilities, where work has not been suspended, to ensure daily disinfection of the territories adjacent to the facilities, parking lots, sidewalks, as well as entrance groups and similar public places.

From May 29 2020, Russia, the heads of municipal districts and urban districts of the Novgorod region are obliged to ensure the implementation of works on disinfection of highways, streets, stopping points on the territory of the relevant municipalities.
From May 29 2020, Russia, Novgorod region obliged its citizens to use personal protective equipment (masks and respirators) in all public places.

As of June 4, Lipetsk region, Russia, has prepared for the USE: all examination sites and school buses, which will transport students, will be disinfected. All examination sites will be equipped with non-contact thermometers and hand sanitizers located both at the entrance and in each classroom.

Russia " obliges organizations and individual entrepreneurs that carry out inter-municipal transportation of passengers and luggage by passenger taxis to provide drivers with personal protective equipment, register passengers through a questionnaire, and conduct ongoing disinfection." The hygiene policy takes effect starting from June 19.

Russia "obliges organizations carrying out educational activities on the territory of the Orenburg region providing secondary vocational education:
daily disinfection of the organization's premises, vehicles, regular ventilation with disinfection of the organization's air, creating the necessary conditions for employees and students to comply with the rules of personal hygiene." The hygiene policy takes effect starting from June 19.

description:
Russia " obliges local authorities of municipalities of the Orenburg region:
draw up schedules for the sanitization of public facilities (playgrounds, stopping points, etc.) in the territories of municipalities" The hygiene policy takes effect starting from June 19.

Russia "obliges economic entities continuing to carry out activities in the Orenburg region for the sale of goods,provision of services, including services for the carriage of passengers and baggage, ensure the approval of the schedule for sanitary cleaning and disinfection of sales areas, toilets. Carrying out daily (at least three times a day) processing of external surfaces, disinfection of premises, workplaces, toilets." Hygiene policy takes effect starting from June 19.

description:

As of July 14, more than 3.5 thousand trade enterprises were checked in Lipetsk oblast, Russia, for compliance with epidemiological measures by order of Igor Artamonov, head of the region: trade enterprises are under constant control, any violations of sanitary safety are fined.

description: Order from August 3 of the Governor of Omsk oblast states that starting from August 3, legal entities, individual entrepreneurs engaged in retail trade or providing services, who do not use personal respiratory protection equipment (masks, respirators, bandages or other products that replace them) should not be allowed to offer their services to citizens.

Order from August 3 of the Governor of Omsk oblast states that starting from August 3, legal entities, individual entrepreneurs engaged in retail trade or providing services, who do not use personal respiratory protection equipment (masks, respirators, bandages or other products that replace them) should not be allowed to offer their services to citizens.

In Tver region, boarding schools and orphanages are to be disinfected and provided with personal protective equipment and medicines starting from August 10. The health conditions of pupils will be monitored.
By the new academic year, general cleaning and disinfection will be carried out in all educational institutions of Saint Petersburg, Russia.

The government of the Yaroslavl region has made changes to the operating procedure of organizations and individual entrepreneurs by extending the restrictions related to the prevention of the spread of coronavirus infection in the region until August 18, 2020.

Since early September weekly checks for coronavirus to be conducted in public places in Kazan, Russia. Employees of Rospotrebnadzor in Tatarstan will begin to wash from surfaces in public places to search for a new coronavirus.

Russia "obliges market managers to:
daily cleaning of the territory of markets, disinfection of door handles and doors, frequently used items, trade places, counters and public places.
Carrying out at least twice a week cleaning and disinfection of all areas of the markets, main and utility rooms, trading places, counters, tables, inventory, common areas" The hygiene policy takes effect starting from September 28.

Russia "obliges employers operating on the territory of the Orenburg region: to ensure daily disinfection of office premises, regular ventilation with air disinfection". The hygiene policy takes effect starting from September 28.

Russia "obliges organizations of children's recreation and their recovery:
provide daily disinfection, ventilation, sanitation of the air environment using bactericidal irradiators of the premises of these organizations, disinfection of dishes in food facilities". The hygiene policy takes effect starting from September 28.

Russia "obliges all business entities engaged in the sale of goods, the provision of services, including services for the carriage of passengers and baggage:
carrying out daily (at least three times a day) disinfectant treatment of surfaces in rooms, furniture, furnishings, window sills, armchairs and chairs, door handles, switches, computing, duplicating and other equipment, dishes, taps and washbasins, other sanitary equipment"The hygiene policy takes effect starting from September 28.

description:
The head of Yeniseisk, Valery Nikolsky, appealed to the Governor of Krasnoyarskiy Krai, Alexander Uss, with an initiative to restrict entry to the city of Yeniseisk in connection with the epidemiological situation and the upcoming Easter holidays. The head of the region supported the mayor's proposal and signed the corresponding decree. According to the document, checkpoints (checkpoints) will start operating at the entrances to the city of Yeniseisk and the Verkhnepashinsky village council of the Yenisei district from tomorrow.

It is because Yeniseisk has confirmed cases of coronavirus infection. In addition, despite the general regional regime of self-isolation, there are a lot of tourists in the city.

"From April 15, they will set up three cordons at the entrance to Yeniseysk - from Krasnoyarsk, from the side of the ferry crossing (road to the Severo-Yenisei district) and from the Yenisei district. We will restrict traffic, check documents of those who enter the city. And from the southern sides"

description: Starting on April 28, the Vladimir region (Russia) introduced digital badges. The procedure for registration and use of digital passes for travel within the Vladimir region during the period of the high-alert mode has been approved. A digital pass is a confirmation of the need to be outside the place of residence or stay. It is issued to citizens in the following cases: movement in connection with the implementation of activities that are not suspended, including the provision of transport and delivery services; following to the place of purchase of goods, works, services, the implementation of which is not limited. A digital pass does not need to be issued in the following cases: applying for emergency medical care and for another direct threat to life and health; walking pets at a distance not exceeding 100 meters from the place of residence; removal of municipal solid waste to the nearest place of their accumulation; as well as for citizens under the age of 18 years.

Prior to improving the sanitary-epidemiological situation in the Vladimir Region, citizens who are in the region are obliged not to leave their place of residence (stay). The corresponding decree to prevent the spread of new coronavirus infection was signed by Governor Vladimir Sipyagin. Exceptions to this decree of self-isolation are applying for emergency medical care and cases of another direct threat to life and health; going to work and from work which is not suspended by this decree; movement within the region, if it is directly related to the implementation of abovementioned activities; following to the nearest place of purchase of goods, services, the implementation of which is not limited in accordance with the decree; walking pets at a distance not exceeding 100 meters from the place of residence (stay); removal of municipal solid waste to the nearest waste storage site.
Starting from 31 of March, the government of Krasnodar regions order a lockdown, and residents of the region must stay home. They can leave it only in exceptional situation
From 20.00 March 31 to April 5, 2020 inclusive, the Irkutsk region is entering into self-isolation regime

As of March 31 to April 12, the head of Komi requires all people currently residing in the Komi Republic not to leave houses without urgent medical and consumption needs, which are to be satisfied in the nearest possible place. Exceptions include essential workers and organizations, the activity of which is not restricted by the decree of the President of the Russian Federation (<U+2116>206).
The compulsory self-isolation regime was introduced from March 31, 2020 for the period until further notice on the region of Khanty-Mansia

The head of Udmurtia, Alexander Brechalov, signed an order that introduces an at-home self-isolation regime for all citizens from 18:00 on March 31 until a special order. Particular attention is paid to persons with chronic diseases of the bronchopulmonary, cardiovascular, endocrine systems, and pregnant women.

On March 25 2020 the Head of the KabardinoBalkaria Republic Russia recommended the citizens over the age of 65 to refrain from visiting public placesOn March 31 the policy was made mandatory and additionally included people with diseases of respiratory and endocrine systems
The Republic of Tatarstan, Russian Federation, introduced a mandatory self-isolation regime starting from April 1, 2020
The self-isolation regime for all residents of Khakassia is introduced by the decision of the republican government for the period from 1 to 5 April.
In Khabarovsk region the lockdown regime is announced from 1st April.

The Russian legislature passes amendments to the administrative and criminal codes on March 31 classifying violations related to epidemiological safety, states of alert or emergency, and the spread of misinformation related to such situations as administrative and/or criminal offenses with increasing punishments if said violations lead to deaths.

description: Starting April 1, a self-isolation regime will be introduced for all citizens in the Tambov region of Russia to stop the spread of the coronavirus. Residents of Tambov are allowed to leave their place of residence only in cases of seeking emergency medical care, another direct threat to life and health, or if a citizen needs to be at the workplace. It is also allowed to shop at the nearest store or pharmacy, walk pets at a distance not exceeding one hundred meters from the place of residence, and take out the trash. It was recommended to refrain from visiting religious sites, parks, squares, squares, embankments and other common areas.

From April 1, Kurgan region will be locked down in order to prevent new cases of coronavirus. The regime of mandatory self-isolation was introduced by the decision of the operational headquarters and the decree of the governor of the Kurgan region Vadim Shumkov. This means that everyone, except for citizens working during this period, must stay at home. It is allowed to go to the nearest grocery store, to the pharmacy, take out the trash, walk the dogs no more than a hundred meters from the house, and also seek medical help. In public places, people need to keep a distance of 1.5 meters from each other.

Russia: To oblige citizens from April 1, 2020 until the abolition of the high alert regime for the governing bodies and forces of the territorial subsystem of the unified state system for the prevention and elimination of emergencies of the Republic of Karelia not to leave their place of residence (stay), except for the following cases where citizens obliged to carry documents:seeking emergency (urgent) medical care and cases of other direct threats to life and health; following to the place (from the place) of carrying out activities (including work) that are not suspended in accordance with this order;carrying out activities related to movement within the territory of settlements of the Republic of Karelia, if such movement is directly related to the implementation of activities that are not suspended in accordance with this order (including the provision of transport and delivery services); following to the nearest place of purchase of goods, works, services, the sale of which is not limited in accordance with this order;the need to care for the elderly, as well as people with disabilities and the disabled;
walking pets at a distance not exceeding 100 meters from the place of residence (stay); removal of waste to the nearest waste accumulation site.

Starting from April 1, 2020 Omsk citizens are required not to leave the place of residence (stay), except for the cases of seeking emergency (urgent) medical care and cases of other direct threat to life and health;
following to the place of carrying out activities (including work), which are not suspended in accordance with this order; carrying out activities related to movement within the territory of the Omsk region, if such movement is directly related to the implementation of activities that are not suspended in accordance with this order (including the provision of transport and delivery services); following to the nearest place of purchase of goods, works, services, the sale of which is not limited in accordance with this order; walking pets at a distance not exceeding 100 meters from the place of residence (stay); removal of waste to the nearest waste accumulation site.

Lockdown measures are imposed in Kamchatka krai (Russia) from April 1 to April 5 inclusive. Citizens are not allowed to leave
place of residence (stay), with the exception of cases of emergency, commuting to workplaces that are not suspended, as well as following to the nearest place of purchase of goods and services, walking pets at a distance not exceeding 100 meters from the place of residence (stay), removal of waste to the nearest place of waste accumulation. These  restrictions do not apply in cases of providing medical care, the activities of law enforcement agencies, civil defense and emergency agencies and organizations under their jurisdiction, supervision bodies in the field of consumer protection and human welfare, and other bodies in terms of actions directly aimed at protecting the life, health and other rights and freedoms of citizens, including countering crime, protecting public order, property and ensuring public safety.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: Starting from April 1, North Ossetia requires citizens who are 65 years and those with diseases, that require self-isolation not to leave their places of residence unless the situations that directly threaten their health and life arise.
In Krasnoyarskiy region, the regime of lockdown was announced, starting from the 2nd of April.

In Russia's Chukotka region the governor Roman Kopin has imposed a lockdown from the 2nd of April to the 14th of April.  You can leave the house only in the following cases: for seeking emergency medical care,
in case of threat to life and health, for work, if it is not suspended, to buy essential goods (in shops within walking distance), for walking pets (no further than 100 meters from the house), and for garbage disposal.

description: Starting from April 3, 2020 and until this restriction is lifted, citizens of Tyumen' region are required not to leave their place of residence and allowed to leave iit for specific reasons.
From April 3, 2020 and until this restriction is lifted, citizens of Tyumen' oblast are required not to leave their place of residence

Starting from April 2, Crimea imposes a total lockdown for all citizens. People cannot go out of the houses unless:
1)their lives are threatened
2)they need urgent medical attention
3) they need to buy supplies 
4)they need to throw trash
5)they need to walk their pet
In Russia in Saratov entered the access mode from 2nd April.

Yamalo-Nenets AO (Russia) prohibited persons residing (staying) in the territory of the municipality of the village of Khanymei from leaving their place of residence (stay), except urgent cases including going to the pharmacy and to get medical aid starting from 5th of April

All working (insured) Tambov residents in Russia over 65 have the right to quarantine and apply for sick leave from April 6 to 19, 2020 with an electronic sick leave. This category of citizens must inform the employer by phone, SMS, e-mail or other contactless method about their intention to receive an electronic sick leave for the period of being in quarantine.

Governor’s Decree N 21 (April 3, 2020) – came into force the same day:

The Governor of the Tula Region (Russia) decided on April 3 that citizens over the age of 65 must self-isolate (lockdown) at home or other place of residence from April 6 and until April 19, 2020.

Exceptions:
-	Seeking urgent medical care
-	Shopping (essential goods and supplies; services)
-	Walking pets (within 100-meter radius)
-	Waste disposal

The policy of lockdown that has been enforced in Ingushetia on March 30 was updated on April 7, when the government of Ingushetia has allocated 16 enterprises to the list of strategic organizations in the region, which were allowed to resume work and continue production during the period of mandatory self-isolation. The list includes, among other things, enterprises engaged in the production of dairy products, mineral water, vegetables and fruits, aluminum profiles, etc. Suppliers of building materials, resource supplying organizations, waste disposal operators and oil companies are also resuming work. Aside from that, the previous policy of the region-wide lockdown remains in force.

On April 7, Governor of the Ryazan region Nikolay Lyubimov signed a decree Of the government of the Ryazan region about the villages of Zaokskoye and Korostovo are being quarantined starting from April 8 till April 22.
Starting from 10 of April until 30 of April, all residents of Smolensk region have to follow the regime of self-isolation. Residents older than 65 must go under the regime of total self-isolation.

From April 12, a special order of movement has been introduced in the Kurgan region. Citizens should inform their purposes and intentions to the number +7 (903) 767-26- 68 by SMS while they need to go out.

On April 14 in the Tambov region of Russia, the Tambov Region Health Department urges all citizens to refrain from visiting public places: shopping centers, sports and entertainment events, transport during rush hour.

The government of Leningrad Region, Russia, has introduced enhanced sanitary and epidemiology regime in 13 settlements from April 16, 2020. Those who violate the self-isolation regime rules will be punished with fines.

On June 1 in the Tambov region of Russia, citizens who have taken out sick leave must observe the self-isolation regime in order to minimize the risk of contracting coronavirus infection.

On the territory of the city of Rasskazovo in the Tambov region of Russia, the high alert regime is temporarily tightened. From June 8 to June 14, temporary restrictions were introduced in the municipality aimed at ensuring the sanitary and epidemiological well-being of the population in connection with the spread of the coronavirus. Citizens arriving in the city, including those working on a rotational basis, are obliged to immediately inform the city administration about their arrival, place, dates of actual stay and contact information, as well as fulfill the requirements for 14-day self-isolation at home, which involves being in isolated room and exclusion of contact with family members. And when the first respiratory symptoms appear, immediately seek medical help at the place of stay without visiting medical organizations.

description: After large industrial enterprises resumed work, the region of Tambov in Russia began executing raid activities on April 13 to check compliance with sanitary and epidemiological measures. This is supervised by the regional department for the development of industry and trade, together with specialists from Rospotrebnadzor. Inspection raids are taking place as part of the execution of the regional administration's decree on measures to reduce the risks of the spread of coronavirus infection in the region. All organizations, whose activities are not suspended, must work, strictly observing additional sanitary measures which include: ensuring the minimum required number of employees, maintaining a distance between them of at least 1.5 meters, daily contactless temperature measurement, disinfecting the surfaces that are most often touched by the hands of employees. It is forbidden to admit to work those who have signs of respiratory diseases and fever.

description:
Patient routing to inpatient healthcare facilities changed .
Patients with acute therapeutic, surgical and other pathologies were redistributed to other inpatient institutions in the city of Kursk.

Citizens with suspected myocardial infarction are now sent on indications to the regional vascular center of the regional clinical hospital or hospital no. 1 in the city of Kursk.

Stroke patients are hospitalized in the neurological departments of the city of Kursk after consultation at the regional vascular center of the regional clinical hospital.

Patients from regions of the region with cardiovascular diseases will be referred to the nearest vascular centers; they are located in Zheleznogorsk, Gorshechensky, Medvensky and Rylsky regions.

description:
Russia " informs that Stopcoronavirus56.rf single portal launched in the Orenburg region
The portal has combined an operational news summary, white papers, hotline telephone numbers and answers to frequently asked questions. From April 7, it is available at stopkoronavirus56.rf. The project was created with the support of the Government of the Orenburg Region, the Ministry of Digital Development and Communications, the Development Corporation of the Orenburg Region.
- In the current difficult situation, this is a necessary information resource, whose task is to provide answers to key, pressing questions of the population and business of the Orenburg region. Realizing this, we made every effort to make the portal appear as early as possible, - noted the Minister of Digital Development and Communications of the Orenburg Region Denis Tolpeikin." According to the schedule, representatives of the economic block of the Government, profile ministers, heads of the infrastructure for supporting small and medium-sized businesses answer questions.
Contact phone +7 (3532) 98-75-75." The other type policy takes effect starting from April 9.
type_text: a single direct line for representatives of the business community

description:
Russia "The Interfax Group announced the provision of free access to the SPARK analytical system for small and medium-sized companies for the period of self-isolation.
- Many small and medium-sized businesses find themselves in a difficult situation, while now it is more important for them than ever to promptly learn about changes from their counterparties, effectively manage accounts receivable, and monitor changes in the market. Companies are forced to transfer their employees to remote work, they need additional jobs. Taking all this into account, we temporarily opened free access for small and medium-sized businesses to the SPARK-Interfax system. I am sure that this will help the business to minimize losses, reduce risks, and continue to effectively interact with counterparties, - said Roman Laba, Deputy General Director of Interfax, Project Manager of SPARK. - The SPARK team has taken the necessary measures to ensure uninterrupted operation under conditions of increased load. We continue to operate 24/7, ”he added.

The system allows you to check the status and details of a company or an individual entrepreneur, to receive extracts from the Unified State Register of Legal Entities and USRIP, SPARK-Risks and SPARK-Profile reports to assess the financial condition, reliability of counterparties and manage accounts receivable." The other type policy takes effect starting from April 10.
type_text: The Interfax Group announced the provision of free access to the SPARK analytical system for small and medium-sized companies for the period of self-isolation.

description: In response to a federal law in Russia, the regional government in Tambov announced that starting on April 1 criminal liabilities have been established for the dissemination of knowingly false and inaccurate information if it poses a threat to the life and health of people. Either a fine of 300 to 700 thousand rubles is provided, or correctional labor for up to a year, or forced labor for up to three years, or imprisonment for the same period. If the act entailed, through negligence, the death of a person or other grave consequences, then the fine is increased to 2 million rubles, and imprisonment is provided for up to five years. Additionally, the code provides for liability for dissemination in the media and on the Internet under the guise of reliable, deliberately false information, as well as for failure to comply with the rules of conduct in an emergency or when a high alert regime is introduced.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description:
Russia"In connection with the massive transition of the population to remote interaction in all spheres of life: remote work on the network, online shopping, the exchange of emails, the use of Internet banks, cybercriminals have also become more active in the digital environment. In this regard, we remind the residents of Orenburg about the need to remain vigilant and observe basic information security rules.
One of the main types of fraud is phishing. Its purpose is to obtain logins, passwords, credit card details by forging messages from a trusted source. Phishing pages on the Internet are very similar to the original ones.
To avoid receiving phishing messages, the first thing to do is set up your mail. Disable preview, set up spam filters, enable two-factor authentication on your inbox. Second, look for the refresh button of your browser to install the latest up-to-date version and enable the anti-phishing option. Third, update your antivirus databases. Install security software on all computer equipment with which you access the Internet. Manufacturers provide some versions of antivirus software for free or with a grace period.
Do not open or download email attachments from unknown or questionable recipients. Check the data in the message from several sources. Remember, no real employee has the right to demand information on a bank card, logins and passwords from you. " The public awareness measures policy takes effect starting from April 2.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate

description: On April 30th, taxi drivers received recommendations for the prevention of coronavirus infection in the Vladimir region (Russia). On the eve of the May holidays, employees of the Department of Enterprise Development, Trade and the Service Industry of the Oblast Administration handed out protective masks and memos on safety measures for passenger transportation to taxi drivers. The information sheet lists the preventive measures that taxi drivers must follow. During working hours, the taxi driver must: wear personal protective equipment (mask) during the transport of passengers; have a stock of disposable masks, disinfectant wipes, skin antiseptics for treating hands, disinfectants; after disembarking passengers, carry out ventilation, wet cleaning of the passenger compartment and preventive disinfection by wiping with a disinfectant wipe (or disinfectant solution) of the taxi compartment (wiping door handles, parts of the backs of seats, other surfaces).

The Hot Line began operating on May 6 around the clock. According to the director of the Department of Health of the Vladimir Region Alexei Mozalev, the organization of the “hotline” will help to increase the effectiveness of managerial decisions and the speed of response to emerging problems by improving feedback from health facilities.

In the Petushinsky district of the Vladimir region (Russia), a special regime is introduced to counter the spread of Covid-19. From 00:00 April 16 to April 30, 2020, a set of restrictive measures aimed at ensuring the sanitary and epidemiological welfare of the population is introduced in the territory of the Petushinsky district of the Vladimir region. For the period of the complex of restrictive and other measures, entry into the Petushinsky district and departure from it of citizens who do not have registration at the place of residence (place of stay) within the territory of a special regime is prohibited. Upon entering the territory with a special regime by rail, citizens who are registered at the place of residence (place of stay) in the Petushinsky district are obliged to immediately inform the district administration by phone 8 (49243) 2-71-02 of their arrival and leave contact details. These citizens must have immediate self-isolation for a period of at least 14 calendar days. If signs of an infectious disease appear, inform the medical organization immediately.

description: From April 18, head of Mordovia Republic (Russia) requires that citizens who arrive from the subjects of the Russian Federation where cases of coronavirus infection (COVID-19) are registered: 1) to transmit information about the place and dates of their stay, return, contact information to the relevant local government body at the place of residence (place of stay); 2) ensure self-isolation at home at the place of residence (place of stay) for a period of 14 days from the date of return (arrival) to the Republic of Mordovia. Leaving the place of residence (place of stay), visiting work, school, shops, pharmacies, public places and mass gatherings, using public transport, contacting with third parties are prohibited, except in cases of requesting emergency (urgent) medical care and cases of other direct threat to life and health (in this case, must indicate the status as " isolated»); 3) when the first signs of respiratory infection appear, stay at the place of residence and immediately seek medical help from a medical organization at the place of attachment without visiting medical organizations (calling a doctor at home) to issue disability certificates; 4) comply with the instructions of Officials of the Federal service for supervision of consumer rights protection and human welfare in the Republic of Mordovia to conduct additional sanitary and anti-epidemic (preventive) measures related to the observance of self-isolation at home.

description: Starting from the 17th of March Sakha, the region of Russian Federation, is recommending its employers to follow these 7 advices.1)To measure temperature of employees with a mandatory suspension of those who have high temperature.2) To help workers to comply with a self isolation mode at home. 3) To provide information about contacts of infected person in the case of request from Office of the Federal Service for supervision of consumer protection and human well-being of Republic of Sakha and disinfect rooms in which infected person was. 4) To keep out of the workplace individuals who traveled to countries that have registered COVID 19 cases and individuals who by the decision of sanitary doctors should be in quarantine. 5) To optimize number of workers from different regions of the Russian Federation in the case of shift method of work and increase  duration of the shift up to three months.6) To transfer workers to remote mode of work if it is possible to do so. 7)To abstain from sending workers to business trips to other countries and regions of Russia that have unfavorable COVID 19 situation.It is also advised to abstain from organizing and participating in events that have foreign citizens.
institution_status: This type of business ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with no conditions attached

description: It was announced on March 18 in the Tambov region of Russia that the leaders of all organizations, enterprises, and institutions are required to strengthen the disinfection regime at their subordinate facilities and conduct daily preventive disinfection in accordance with the recommendations developed by the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Well-Being. All employers are required to provide the ability to treat hands to employees at the entrance to the organization and during the working day with skin antiseptics, or disinfectant wipes. At workplaces, the measurement of body temperature of employees (according to indications) should be provided. Room cleaning should be carried out using virucidal disinfectants in all rooms every 2 hours. At the same time, organizations should have at least a five-day supply of disinfectants for cleaning and processing the hands of employees, personal protective equipment for respiratory organs in case of detection of persons with signs of an infectious disease (masks, respirators). Whenever possible, it is also recommended that bactericidal lamps and air recirculators be used in the working rooms to regularly disinfect the air.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions_This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description:

description:
From March 28 to April 5, the work of public catering organizations will be suspended in the Krasnoyarsk Territory, retail facilities will be closed, with the exception of pharmacies and stores with food and non-food essential goods, gas stations. Beauty salons, swimming pools, fitness centers, spa centers and other institutions that provide services in the beauty and recreation industry will stop working.

In addition, entertainment, cultural and sports events will be suspended on the territory of the Krasnoyarsk Territory, including in parks of culture and recreation, shopping and entertainment centers and other places of mass visits of citizens.

Cinemas, children's playrooms and entertainment centers for children will temporarily shut down. Also, temporarily, until April 5, the work of kindergartens has been suspended.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down

description: On March 30 it was announced in the Tambov region of Russia that for that week only grocery stores, pharmacies, telecom stores and retail outlets selling pet supplies and essential goods were allowed to work. Sanitary measures have been strengthened in all retail outlets. To reduce the interaction of customers with each other, border lines appeared near the cash registers, hand dispensers were installed at the entrances, and sanitation of premises and carts was strengthened. Some stores have introduced special hours to serve older customers. The administrative code of the Russian Federation provides for liability for violation of standards in the field of sanitary and hygienic safety of the population. By a court decision, Rospotrebnadzor may suspend the operation of a trading enterprise for up to 90 days.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

The work of beauty salons and other facilities, which provide such services, is suspended.
The government of the Volgograd region also suspends the work of clubs, sections, other leisure activities in social service centers, as well as the work of libraries"

description: On April 2 it was announced by the Tambov regional government in Russia that in accordance with the presidential decree there will be non-working days from March 30 to April 3, 2020. description:

description:
Russia is enforcing a restriction and regulation of businesses policy "All enterprises and organizations of the Orenburg region, which continue to work on a non-working week, are obliged to provide employees with service certificates or certificates of employment.
Certificates can be issued in free form, sealed with the seal of the organization and the signature of the head. The main thing is that the document contains information that confirms the need to stay at the workplace from March 28 until a special order.
An employee who is on the street, in transport, or in public places, at the request of a representative of the authorities, must present an identity card and a certificate from the place of work (service card). At the same time, the profile of the enterprise or organization must comply with the requirements of the Decree of the President of the Russian Federation dated March 25, 2020 No. 206 and the decree of the Governor of the Orenburg region dated March 17, 2020 No. 112-uk with amendments and additions." The policy was announced April 2.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
Russia"is enforcing policy for working citizens over 65 who have chosen self-isolation will be able to get sick leave from April 6 to 19. The appointment of temporary disability benefits due to quarantine will not require citizens to fill out any documents. Sick leave payments will come to citizens directly from the Social Insurance Fund.
The employer will have to transfer citizens from the risk group to remote work with the payment of full wages or transfer the data to the Social Insurance Fund for registration of temporary disability benefits.
Calculation of benefits for temporary disability for elderly citizens will be carried out according to the general rules. With more than 8 years of experience, days of incapacity for work are paid in 100%. The base is the average monthly earnings, but not more than the maximum possible allowance (the average maximum amount is 69,961.65 rubles per month).
The payment of benefits will be carried out by the FSS of Russia at a time for the entire specified period within 7 calendar days from the date of formation of the electronic certificate of incapacity for work." The restriction and regulation of businesses policy takes effect starting from April 6.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
Russia "informs Sewing Factory LLC sews 7000 masks per day
Sewing Factory LLC was engaged in sewing children's clothing on the basis of the regional business incubator. Currently, masks are sewn here: adult workers at home, young workers in a business incubator. 7000 masks are sewn per day - on order for grocery stores and companies in Orenburg.
 “A temporary change in the production profile will save jobs and the factory itself,” says Viktoria Agapova, technologist at Garment Factory LLC.
According to the technologist, placement in a business incubator is a significant support for small businesses. The rent, which was quite acceptable before, will now be reduced.
- In accordance with the order of the Governor of the Orenburg region "On the plan of priority measures (actions) to ensure the stability of the economy of the Orenburg region" from April 1, a decreasing coefficient of 0.01 will be applied. The cost of one square meter will not exceed 2 rubles per month. Also, from April 1, no penalties will be applied to previously accrued, but unpaid payments for three months, - said Pavel Borodin, director of the Orenburg Regional Business Incubator.
The Orenburg regional business incubator operates in a regular mode; several enterprises with a continuous production cycle work on the territory." The restriction and regulation of businesses policy takes effect starting from April 7.
institution_status: This type of business ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with no conditions attached

description:
Russia "introduces agro-industrial complex enterprises to the list of economic sectors that are allowed to operate under restrictive measures. According to the Decree of the Governor and the recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor, measures have been developed to protect against the spread of coronavirus infection.

In all divisions of the agro-industrial complex, premises and equipment are sanitized daily. The availability of at least a five-day supply of disinfectants for cleaning premises and processing the hands of employees, personal respiratory protection equipment in case of identifying persons with signs of an infectious disease (masks, respirators). Work areas are ventilated every two hours. Employees of food industry enterprises undergo daily medical examinations.

Before each milking operation, milking machine operators apply antiseptic to their hands and wear gloves.
At enterprises and workshops, workplaces are defined at a distance of one and a half to two meters from each other.

Explanatory conversations were held with all employees about the need to observe the rules of personal and public hygiene. At the slightest symptom of infection - a runny nose, fever, cough, etc. - employees inform the heads of departments, go into self-isolation mode, turn to the local doctor or FAP employee." The restriction and regulation of businesses policy takes effect starting from April 10.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Agriculture; forestry and fishing") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Starting April 21, in the Tambov region of Russia, the work of closed-type catering establishments that provide meals to employees of organizations and institutions (these include canteens, cafes and other catering establishments for employees) will resume. Such organizations are obliged to take additional sanitary and anti-epidemic measures in accordance with the instructions and recommendations of the regional Rospotrebnadzor. Measure the body temperature of workers using a non-contact method on a daily basis; regularly wipe the surfaces with the most intense hand contact with a disinfectant solution; ensure that the distance between employees and visitors is at least 1.5 meters, avoid allowing the formation of queues; do not allow persons with signs of respiratory diseases to work with an increased body temperature; treat hands with antiseptics; ensure the use of disposable tableware with its subsequent collection, disinfection and destruction in accordance with the established procedure, etc. It should also be ensured that each employee uses personal protective equipment (masks, gloves). It is especially important that the number of employees of such enterprises involved in work during the specified period should be the minimum necessary for the normal operation of the institution.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Starting on April 21st, hairdressing salons and computer workshops are allowed to re-open in the Vladimir region (Russia). The list of organizations and individual entrepreneurs of the Vladimir Region that operate on non-working days established by the Decree of the President of Russia “On Measures to Ensure Sanitary and Epidemiological Well-Being of the Population in the Russian Federation in Connection with the Spread of a New Coronavirus Infection (Covid-19)” has been expanded. The decree was signed by Governor Vladimir Sipyagin. The following categories of organizations and individual entrepreneurs of the region are additionally included in this list: those engaged in the provision of hairdressing services; providing cosmetic services in beauty salons with a medical license; engaged in the repair of household and computer equipment; providing dental services in an emergency and emergency form. The heads of all organizations and individual entrepreneurs from the list approved by the Governor are obliged to ensure the implementation of the recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor on the organization of work and the prevention of new coronavirus infection among workers.
institution_status: This type of business ("Personal Grooming Businesses") is allowed to open with no conditions attached

After the nationwide declaration of the end of the days off starting from May 12, the Head of North Ossetia issues a Decree stating the further extension of days off in North Ossetia until May 31. It bans all entertaining, cultural, educational, sports, and other events, regardless of the number of participants; Suspends the work of restaurants, cafes, canteens, buffets, bars, snack bars, fast food enterprises, and other catering establishments; Suspends the work of all retail facilities and markets, with the exception of retail trade in terms of the sale of food products and (or) non-food products located outside the territory of shopping centers indicated as essential goods; Suspends the work of beauty, SPA, massage, tanning salons, baths, saunas and other facilities in which similar services are provided; Suspends the provision of dental services, with the exception of the provision of dental care in emergency form; Suspends the work of pools, fitness centers, water parks, and other sports facilities, as well as sports sections, clubs.

description: On June 1st, Ramzan Kadyrov, head of the Chechen Republic (Russia), approved the second stage of lifting restrictive measures during the coronavirus pandemic. At a meeting of the Operational Headquarters for Combating COVID-19, the Head of the Chechen Republic, Ramzan Kadyrov, approved the second stage of lifting the restrictive measures introduced during the pandemic. According to the decision, from June 1, the opening of hairdressing salons, beauty salons, ateliers, the resumption of medical and dental practices, the activities of colleges, universities, the MFC, walks and outdoor sports, the functioning of authorities (no more than 70% of the staff number), work cultural objects, retail trade in non-food products (no more than 800 sq. m.). Also, together with the DUM of the republic, it was decided to allow Friday prayers in the central mosques of districts and urban districts and to soften the requirements for mourning ceremonies. At the same time, Ramzan Kadyrov stressed that it is necessary to ensure strict adherence to all precautionary norms - from ensuring social distance to the presence of masks. He added that the epidemiological situation in the republic is stable.
institution_status: This type of business  ("All or unspecified businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Starting on June 2, dental clinics can resume working in the Vladimir region (Russia). The relevant changes were made on June 2 in the resolution of the Chief State Sanitary Doctor for the Vladimir Region dated 03.03.2020 No. 1777. The changes concern not only the provision of planned dental care. The ban on visits to outpatient medical organizations in a planned manner does not apply to patients with diseases and conditions in which delaying the provision of medical care can lead to deterioration of the condition, a threat to their life and health. In addition, the list of exceptions includes acute diseases, injuries, exacerbations of chronic diseases in relation to patients who undergo (complete) a course of treatment in a day hospital. Outpatient health facilities can also be visited for routine immunization and immunization screening.

On May 29, the Governor of Omsk issued a decree stating that retail facilities, both that are equipped with separate entrances (exits) and that are located in shopping malls, supermarkets, shopping and entertainment centers, which have sales area of more than 400 sq. meters are not allowed to operate starting from June 4 and until the end of the high-alert regime.

description: On May 29, the Governor of Omsk oblast issued an order stating that starting from June 4, shopping and entertainment centers, supermarkets, and malls are required to limit working hours of retail shops (except for pharmacies and grocery shops) until 20.00 on working days and close them during the weekends. They are also required not to have more than one person per 4 sq.m. in a shopping area, thus providing necessary conditions for social distancing of customers by limiting the number of visitors served at a time. Moreover, they are required to ensure control over the use of personal respiratory protection equipment by personnel working with visitors (masks, respirators, bandages, or other products that replace them) and usage of antibacterial wipes, skin antiseptics by the personnel.

description:
In Khakassiya, starting from Thursday, June 18, it is allowed to resume the work of public catering points located in the open air: summer cafes on verandas and terraces.
Also, from June 18 in Khakassia, it will be allowed to open fitness centers, gyms, swimming pools, stadiums and other institutions of physical culture and sports, provided that the sports facility is loaded by no more than 25% of its one-time bandwidth. The training of members of sports teams is also resumed, provided that the distance between the practitioners is at least 5 meters.

At the same time, before opening, both catering establishments and sports establishments must receive special readiness passports. Forms of passports with a list of all requirements are published on the portal of the republican government.

At the same time, before opening, both catering establishments and sports establishments must receive special readiness passports. Forms of passports with a list of all requirements are published on the portal of the republican government.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Open-air cafes and restaurants are allowed to open from June 23rd in the Vladimir region (Russia). From June 23, catering establishments will be able to open, offering service in the open air, including on summer verandas and terraces, if there is a stationary catering establishment with a full set of production workshops, depending on the range of prepared dishes. To open catering enterprises, it is necessary to arrange tables at a distance of at least 1.5 meters from each other; the surfaces most intensively in contact with the hands of visitors should be regularly treated with a disinfectant solution. It is also important to minimize the queues and crowds of customers. In this case, summer verandas will be able to work subject to the recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor.

description: On June 25, restrictions on the work of fitness centers and travel agencies have been lifted in the Vladimir region (Russia). From June 27, physical education and sports in the fresh air, as well as in open and closed sports facilities, in sports and recreation centers and fitness clubs, are allowed in compliance with the prescribed measures for the prevention of coronavirus infection: with respect to the distance of the placement of sports equipment at least 1,5 meters, the use of cabins in the dressing room, taking into account the social distance and with the limitation on the area of <U+200B><U+200B>halls for sports: at least 4 sq. m for 1 visitor.  Travel agencies can also start working subject to the sale of tour packages to the constituent entities of the Russian Federation, where restrictions have been lifted and a favorable sanitary and epidemiological situation is present. At the same time, the ban continues to apply to swimming pools, swimming clubs, and beaches, and it is also prohibited to hold physical culture and sports events. description: Shopping centers in the Vladimir region will reopen on 6 July. On June 30, Governor Vladimir Sipyagin made changes to the Decree of 12.05.2020 No. 127 "On the suspension and restriction of the activities of organizations and individual entrepreneurs" regarding the trade of non-food products in the region. However, restrictions on work in retail outlets of catering establishments, food courts, sports complexes, beauty salons, leisure centers, children's play areas, cinemas, vending machines and recreational facilities (including shops) continue to apply. In addition, the restriction on holding mass events and promotions in shopping malls is not lifted. It is noted that the owners of shopping centers will need to strictly monitor the number of visitors simultaneously on the trading floors. One person must have at least 4 square meters of floor space. Shopping facilities will be able to open only if all methodological recommendations of the Federal Service for Supervision of Consumer Rights Protection and Human Well-being for the prevention of new coronavirus infection in trade enterprises are observed. Before the opening of shopping malls, inspections will be organized there for compliance with the recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor.

description: Temporary restrictions have been removed from the activities of driving schools in the Vladimir region (Russia). On July 14, Governor Vladimir Sipyagin made appropriate changes to the Decrees “On the suspension and restriction of the activities of organizations and individual entrepreneurs” and “On the introduction of a high alert regime”. Organizations and individual entrepreneurs implementing professional training programs for vehicle drivers can resume educational activities in compliance with the following requirements: examination and questioning for signs of ARVI of students and instructors before the start of training sessions, as well as the organization of contactless thermometry; non-admission of other persons, except for the instructor, student, as well as the traffic police inspector (when passing the exam), from being in the cabin of the training car during a practical lesson on driving; the use of skin antiseptics by the trainee and the instructor, as well as personal protective equipment (masks and gloves) and ensuring their supply at the rate of a shift every 2 hours; the presence of disposable bags in the car for the collection and further disposal of personal protective equipment; carrying out preventive wet cleaning of the training car interior (after each student), as well as regular disinfection of internal contact surfaces with a virucidal agent (every 2 hours).
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions

description: Starting on July 21, mechanized outdoor amusement rides have been allowed to re-open in the Vladimir region (Russia). Governor Vladimir Sipyagin, at the suggestion of the Regional Office of Rospotrebnadzor, made appropriate changes to Decree No. 127 of 05/12/2020 "On the suspension and restriction of activities of organizations and individual entrepreneurs" and Decree No. 38 of 03/17/2020 "On the introduction of a high alert regime." Before opening on the territory of attractions, a general cleaning should be carried out using disinfectants, and during the period of operation, it is necessary to disinfect all surfaces at least once every two hours. At the entrance to the amusement zone, visitors will treat their hands with an antiseptic; to ensure social distance, special markings must be applied in front of the ticket offices and the entrance to the attractions, where people will sit freely. All amusement riders must be provided with sufficient personal protective equipment and skin antiseptics. Their thermometry is prescribed to be carried out twice a day - in the morning and in the evening. Contacts between employees should be minimized.

description: Starting on August 6, the Vladimir region (Russia) is entering the third stage of lifting restrictions related to Covid-19. But the ban on holding mass events remains. A number of amendments were made to the Decree of 17.03.2020 No. 38 "On the introduction of a high alert regime", canceling the "coronavirus" restrictions, and the Decree of 12.05.2020 No. 127 "On the suspension and restriction of the activities of organizations and individual entrepreneurs" was declared invalid. The documents were prepared on behalf of Governor Vladimir Sipyagin in connection with the transition of the region to the third stage of lifting restrictions. Trade and service enterprises are allowed to work in the region - without limiting the number of simultaneously served visitors and the area of <U+200B><U+200B>the facility, all educational institutions and recreation areas, massage and spa salons, organizations that transport passengers and luggage. At the same time, strict adherence to hygiene, social distancing, disinfection, self-isolation for people over 65 and suffering from chronic diseases, the use of masks in transport and public places are preserved.

description:
The Ministry of Economic, Territorial Development and Trade of the Chechen Republic temporarily introduces new rules for servicing the population in the MFC. (the Ministry of Economic, Territorial Development and Trade of the Chechen Republic)
As explained in the ministry, a temporary restriction of measures is provided in accordance with the recommendations of the Ministry of Economic Development of Russia in order to minimize the possible spread of new coronavirus infection (COVID-19) when serving the population in the country's MFC.
So, in all MFCs, the time for receiving visitors is reduced. According to the new rules, admission will be conducted only by appointment, which can be done on the website of the Republican MFC. For elderly people who are in a special risk zone due to the coronavirus pandemic (65+), home-based care is provided, for which MFC employees will travel with the electronic record on the above site (no more than 3 visits per day).

description:
Russia"Since March 30, the Pension Fund of the Orenburg Region has been accepting pensioners exclusively by appointment by calling the hotline: 98-16-00, 98-00-86, 98-16-84, 98-17-14.
Issues that arise can be resolved remotely:
- through the Personal Account on the Pension Fund website or the State Services portal;
- by sending an appeal by mail;
- by calling the "hot line".
Hot line phones and addresses of Pension Fund offices in cities and districts of the region are listed on the PFR website in the "Contacts and Addresses" section.
Receiving all services related to maternity (family) capital is also available remotely in the Personal Account.
Employers can send reports by mail without visiting client services, as well as at any time connect to the electronic document flow with the FIU authorities and submit reports in electronic form." Restriction and regulation of government services policy takes effect starting from March 30.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached

Russia "suspends the reception of visitors in the tax authorities of the Orenburg region until April 30

For organizations and individual entrepreneurs, there is an opportunity to interact with the tax authority via telecommunications channels in the manner of official electronic document management.
You can contact the tax authority to resolve issues electronically through the services of the website of the Federal Tax Service of Russia: "Contact the Federal Tax Service of Russia", personal accounts or by calling the federal number of the Unified Contact Center of the Federal Tax Service of Russia 8-800-222-22-22." description:
Russia"is enforcing policy for working citizens over 65 who have chosen self-isolation will be able to get sick leave from April 6 to 19. The appointment of temporary disability benefits due to quarantine will not require citizens to fill out any documents. Sick leave payments will come to citizens directly from the Social Insurance Fund.
   The employer will have to transfer citizens from the risk group to remote work with the payment of full wages or transfer the data to the Social Insurance Fund for registration of temporary disability benefits.
   Calculation of benefits for temporary disability for elderly citizens will be carried out according to the general rules. With more than 8 years of experience, days of incapacity for work are paid in 100%. The base is the average monthly earnings, but not more than the maximum possible allowance (the average maximum amount is 69,961.65 rubles per month).
   The payment of benefits will be carried out by the FSS of Russia at a time for the entire specified period within 7 calendar days from the date of formation of the electronic certificate of incapacity for work." The restriction and regulation of government services takes effect starting from April 6.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description: Starting on April 8, employment centers of the Vladimir region (Russia) switched to a remote mode of work with the population and employers (phone, mail, Internet). Registration of citizens for job search continues, applications for the selection of workers from employers are accepted, assistance is provided in the selection of suitable employment options for job seekers, a referral to vocational training is made, unemployment benefits are paid. During the period of increased readiness, visits to employment centers by citizens and employers are not allowed. Interaction with recipients of public services is carried out only using contactless methods (telephone, mail, Internet resources).
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Issuing of permits/certificates and/or processing of government documents
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached

description:
Russia "informs the multifunctional center for the provision of state and municipal services accepts applicants by appointment
- Understanding the importance and necessity of obtaining certain services, as well as the fact that the multifunctional center is currently the only opportunity for citizens who do not have personal accounts on the portal of public services, or portals of state authorities, to submit documents for the necessary services, GAU " MFC "in a limited mode continues its work in this difficult period," explains the director of the MFC Anatoly Shabelnikov.

Last week, residents of Orenburg could apply to the multifunctional center for the provision of state and municipal services for obtaining and replacing passports, registering, and also picking up ready-made documents. The call center is a multifunctional center for the provision of state and municipal services, providing advice and receiving calls on all issues, without stopping its work. The number of employees advising citizens by telephone has increased as the number of calls has almost doubled.

Applicants who arrive at the appointed time, wearing medical masks and without accompanying persons, will be admitted to the building." The restriction and regulation of government services policy takes effect starting from April 9.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Issuing of permits/certificates and/or processing of government documents
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached

description: Starting on April 17, people with disabilities will be extended in confirmation of their disabilities in absentia automatically in the Vladimir region (Russia). “If the period of the next re-examination falls on the period from March 1 to October 1, 2020, the previously established disability group, including for children with disabilities, will be automatically extended without contacting a medical organization and a bureau. Disability is extended for a period of 6 months and is established from the date up to which disability was established at the previous examination, ”said Lyudmila Moroz, head of the Main Bureau of Medical and Social Expertise in the Vladimir Region. Disability extension will be carried out without a request for a medical and social examination. The changes were adopted in accordance with the Decree of the Government of the Russian Federation of 09.04.2020 No. 467 “On the temporary procedure for recognizing a person as a disabled person” until October 1 of this year.

description: Starting from June 1 until June 11, working citizens from 65 years old will receive the medical leave in the Vladimir region (Russia). In accordance with the Decree of the Government of Russia dated 05/30/2020 No. 791 from June 1 to June 11, 2020, the mechanism for issuing disability certificates in the case of quarantine was extended to insured persons aged 65 years and older. The employer must ensure the transfer of citizens who are not on regular leave from the risk group to remote work with the payment of full wages or transfer information to the Social Insurance Fund for processing temporary disability benefits. The calculation of temporary disability benefits for elderly citizens in the case of quarantine is made at a time from the first day of disability at the expense of the Social Insurance Fund of the Russian Federation. The appointment of such benefits will not require employees to fill out any documents. Disability certificate, as before, will be generated automatically.

description: Parks, libraries and museums are opening in the Vladimir region starting on June 26th. It is allowed to visit parks and squares, following the social distance of 1.5-2 meters. Local authorities are recommended to organize the acaricidal treatment of recreation sites. Temporarily, until the abolition of the high alert regime, the work of cultural organizations (institutions) is being restored in order to maintain buildings and premises, but so far without providing services to the population (and museums and libraries will resume work with the provision of services to the population from tomorrow). According to the documents, libraries can resume work - subject to strict observance of the Rospotrebnadzor regulations on ensuring the safety of employees and visitors. For museums, restrictions on work are lifted on condition that individual excursions or group excursions are conducted with no more than 5 people; ensuring social distance between groups and visitors of at least 1.5 meters and compliance with all epidemiological standards.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service provided by the government is provided with conditions atttached

description:
On April 20, The Ministry of Education of Krasnoyarskiy Krai anoouced that the All-Russian Testing Works for students in grades 4-8 has been postponed to the fall of 2020. They are planned to be held in September-October.

More than six million schoolchildren of grades 4-8 and 10-11 were supposed to participate in the All-Russian Testing Works this year. In grades 10-11, testing took place in March, before the epidemiological situation demanded to transfer schools to distance learning.

For grades 4-8, testing will not be held until the end of the current academic year. In the fall, at the beginning of the new school year, they will be written by students who have transferred to grades 5-9.

description: Starting on August 20th, it is allowed to hold mass events in cultural institutions in the Vladimir region (Russia). It is allowed to conduct cultural and educational events in cultural institutions. At the same time, the auditoriums can be filled only to 50-70 percent of their capacity. Also, the provisions of the methodological recommendations of Rospotrebnadzor on the implementation of preventive measures to prevent new coronavirus infection in the implementation of the activities of theaters and concert organizations must be observed. The ban on holding leisure, entertainment, exhibition, advertising and other public events with the full-time presence of people, including in parks of culture and rest, shopping and entertainment centers, and other places of mass visits of citizens, remains. An exception was made for cultural and educational events, as well as for physical culture and sports events without involving spectators.

description: From April 27, the use of masks will become mandatory in the Vladimir region (Russia). In order to prevent the spread of coronavirus infection in the Vladimir Region, Governor Vladimir Sipyagin amended Decree of March 17, 2020, No. 38 “On the introduction of high alert”. It includes forced measures of restrictions before the May holidays season. From April 27, without personal protective equipment, it will not be possible to visit retail and service facilities whose activities are not suspended; pharmacies and drugstores; bodies of state power and local self-government of the region, as well as organizations subordinate to them; railway and bus stations, stations, as well as use all types of public transport, including taxis.

description: On May 21, the Ministry of Education in Moscow oblast, Russia, announced that holding <U+0415><U+0413><U+042D>(governmental exam for school graduates) will be permitted only if all epidemiological safety rules are met. All people in the building should wear masks, the rooms should be equipped with sanitizers and other protective materials, and students should sit in a safe distance from each other.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: On July 15, Russia's Head sanitary doctor required people to observe social distancing with no less than 1 meter between people in public places and in public transport. The exceptions are for taxi services provision.
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.

description: Russia "prohibit the conduct of theater and entertainment, cultural and educational, entertainment and sports, sports, physical culture, exhibition, educational, advertising and other events on the territory of the Orenburg region, regardless of the number of participants, with the exception of meetings with voters held by candidates for deputies of representative bodies and for other elective positions in local self-government bodies of municipalities of the Orenburg region, public authorities of the Orenburg region with the number of participants not exceeding 15 people in the adjoining territories, observing a social distance and using personal protective equipment (masks and gloves); activities related to the preparation for the conduct and conduct of the unified state exam." The restriction of mass gatherings policy takes effect starting from July 31
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description:
Russia "obliges local government bodies of municipalities of the Orenburg region:
organize, in conjunction with organizations and individual entrepreneurs that transport passengers and baggage on municipal routes of regular transportation, control whether employees and passengers have personal protective equipment (masks and gloves), the current disinfection regime" The social distancing policy takes place starting from September 28.

Russia "obliges local government bodies of municipalities of the Orenburg region:
, ensure that social distancing of at least one and a half meters is observed between persons located on the territory of the local government of the municipal formation of the Orenburg region" The social distancing policy takes place starting from September 28.

description:
Russia "obliges local government bodies of municipalities of the Orenburg region:
organize, together with specialized services on funeral affairs, farewell to the deceased in places specially designed for this, observing social distance of at least one and a half meters between persons, establishing a special regime for admitting persons to be in the relevant territories exclusively in personal protective equipment (masks and gloves)" . The social distancing policy takes place starting from September 28.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart

description: Russia "obliges employers operating on the territory of the Orenburg region:  to provide employees who continue to carry out work functions, before the start of the work shift, with personal protective equipment (masks and gloves) and monitor their use". The social distancing policy takes effect starting from September 28.

Russia “obligates the executive authorities of the Orenburg region:
ensure the observance of social distance of at least one and a half meters between persons who are on the territory of the executive authorities of the Orenburg region" The social distancing policy takes place starting from September 28.

description: According to Rospotrebnadzor Administration of Tatarstan, Russia, the elderly were advised to wash their hands more often, use masks and other respiratory protection in crowded places, and refrain from visiting public places and public transport, especially during rush hours. Persons over 60 were advised not to go out to buy groceries and other goods themselves, to pay utility bills, but to ask relatives or employees of social services.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
